You will work closely with our global teams to integrate, test, and commercially support our embedded software across Mobile, Auto, IoT and XR business groups.      Ability to make decisions and construct plans with minimal, conflicting, and sometimes missing information.      Offsite and occasional onsite work with OEMs and Independent Software Vendors may be required.              Required Skills/Experience              Strong programming experience in C, C++, and Python      Excellent programming skills in C++ (11/14/17). Solid foundation and understanding of data structures, algorithms and AI/CV/Multimedia framework architectures and implementation. Good foundation of object-oriented design patterns or other software design paradigms and usage in your work.      8+ years of experience writing scalable C++ multi-threaded, multi-process software applications for Android/Embedded Linux/QNX operating systems.      Experience in system software programming, threading, mutex, synchronization, communication, and parallel computing to build highly scalable and efficient applications.      Deep understanding of CPU, DSP, Deep Learning Accelerators (NSP/NPU) architectures, system programming and optimization of Multimedia/CV/ML algorithms on hardware acceleration cores using C/C++, assembly language, TVM, OpenMP, OpenCL/CUDA programming frameworks.      Experience with ARM and NSP/Hardware engines Inter-processor communications using RPCs      Experience with at least one DL frameworks like TensorFlow, Caffe, PyTorch, ONNX etc      Familiarity and hands-on experience with various system analysis tools used for memory, performance and hardware resource management for optimization and stability.      Experience with build systems such as CMake, Make, ninja and Yocto for large scale software.      Familiarity with source control tools (Git, GitHub, GitLab, Perforce, etc)      Experience in writing documents on software design, algorithms, and interfaces      Mentor and guide engineers to successfully execute multiple programs.      Prepare clear and concise reports and recommendations for product teams up to senior executives to help drive business decisions and next generation architecture choices.      Defining and developing automation for the team to operate more efficiently.              Preferred Skills/Experience              A go getter attitude to dive deeper and understand technical requirements.      Ability to contribute to all phases of embedded software development including bring-up activities, design, development, and commercialization of software cycles.      Experience with Linux open-source software development projects (either as a committer, contributor, or community manager) is a plus      Experience in using NVIDIA NSight systems/NSight compute for application performance analysis      Knowledge of frameworks and SDKs for Imaging/Computer Vision/Deep Learning (eg, OpenCV, OpenVX, TensorFlow, PyTorch, NVIDIA CuDNN, Tensor RT etc).      Engaging with OpenOCD as a user or as a contributor, JTAG interfacing, and GDB/LLDB to debug targets      Experience with autonomous vehicles domain, standards, and processes (eg, ISO26262, ASPICE)      Solid working experience in kernel development, Android/Linux/QNX, and all too familiar with OS scheduling, debugging, event handling, real-time requirements      Knowledge of compiler optimization techniques for kernel compilers, LLVM is a plus                        Minimum Qualifications:        Bachelors degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 8+ years of Software Engineering or related work experience.    OR    Masters degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 7+ years of Software Engineering or related work experience.    OR    PhD in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 6+ years of Software Engineering or related work experience.      4+ years of work experience with Programming Language such as C, C++, Java, Python, etc                Excellent Written and Verbal Communication Skills are Required            Strong written and verbal communication skills with collaborative work experience, always discussing and learning from each other and driving things forward and making solid progress as one team across geographical regions.      Proven ability to work in a dynamic, multi-tasked environment      Self-starter who likes to be challenged and solve tough complex issues                Education Requirements            Required: Bachelors, Computer Engineering and/or Computer Science, software engineering or closely related discipline with 12-15yrs of relevant work experience      Preferred: Masters, Computer Engineering and/or Computer Science, software engineering or closely related discipline with minimum 12yrs of relevant work experience

column2: The Manager, Software Development is responsible for leading a talented, cross functional team in enhancing our high performance, cloud-based, SaaS web application. Were looking for people who not only have a strong technical background and interest, but who want to drive innovation in people     management, motivation and growth. Youll be working with and mentoring talented individuals and working closely with other teams and departments to brainstorm, innovate and ultimately deliver the best client integration and user experience. If you dont just see management as the next logical step, but are a passionate, driven leader, you can be a great fit for our team.         Youll Get To:            Manage and recruit to a cross functional Agile Team, including Front-end and Back-end Developers, QA Engineers and a Scrum Master, to deliver valuable functionality to our clients.     Define and drive an overall unifying vision for the team and its projects, processes, workflows, and related areas through motivation, consensus building and leading change.     Implement and drive adaptations to team and strategic organizational processes, workflows, and related areas.     Leverage your technical and domain knowledge to partner with Product representatives and your team in defining project deliverables, presenting innovative solutions and, ultimately, to successfully plan, manage and drive the timely delivery of corporate initiatives.     Work with Product and technical stakeholders, as well as Project Management, to define project requirements and deliverables, and, ultimately, plan and manage the timely delivery of high quality projects.     Review and understand core strengths and weaknesses across team members, and proactively engage, mentor, and define goals in order to capitalize upon strengths or mitigate gaps.     Effectively plan, communicate and conduct presentations (project milestones, risk mitigation, road maps, resource needs, technical information, etc.) for senior management and stakeholders, while conveying and driving actionable items to your team.     Work closely, partner, and collaborate with our principal architect to provide exceptional solutions that adhere to, or create, standards across teams.     Manage budget and resources for your team.     Effectively communicate and resolve personnel issues on your team.     Contribute to design reviews, code reviews and hands-on work in your respective domain.     Manage day to day administrative tasks such as time off requests, sick days, etc.     Other duties as assigned.         What Youll Bring:            Recent prior experience as a Manager and/or Technical Lead (Engineer, QA, etc.) in software development of large-scale web applications, with at least 9 years of experience in your respective domain.     Exceptional communication and people skills, with a passion for product excellence, talent development and mentoring.     Knowledge of Build, Deployment, and Continuous Integration concepts and best practices, including full SDLC.     Strong experience in Agile methodology, processes, and best practices.     Strong experience on any one performance tool experience like Jmeter, Load runner, and Getlink.     Strong experience on any one APM tool like NewRelic, Grafana, AppDynamic, etc     Experience in TDD concepts, methodologies, and best practices (i.e., mocks, spies, unit tests, code coverage, etc.). BDD experience is a plus.     Experience with technical design and hands-on work within a modern OOP-based language (C#, Java, Python, etc.), selenium, any one cloud experience, and related stack.     Experience in modern Database platforms, including such items as data modeling, stored procedures, schema definitions, performance and scaling considerations.     Recent experience working with, troubleshooting and tuning across all layers of a modern SaaS, N-Tier, web-based application.     Understanding of QA standards and best practices, including automation, regression, and smoke testing, white/black-box testing, and related QA processes.     Must have team handling or leading experience.     Good to have people manager skills.         We re Even More Excited If You Have:            BS, EE or CS degree is a plus.         Thrive at BlackLine Because You Are Joining:            A technology-based company with a sense of adventure and a vision for the future. Every door at BlackLine is open. Just bring your brains, your problem-solving skills, and be part of a winning team at the worlds most trusted name in Finance Automation!     A culture that is kind, open, and accepting. Its a place where people can embrace what makes them unique, and the mix of cultural backgrounds and varying interests cultivates diverse thought and perspectives.     A culture where BlackLiners continued growth and learning is empowered. BlackLine offers a wide variety of professional development seminars and inclusive affinity groups to celebrate and support our diversity.

column2: You will be responsible for creating clarity in all technical aspects of engineering i.e. providing guidance direction to the teams in matters of design, architecture, implementation, validation and delivery.      You are expected to guide team by pointing out pitfalls, set the coding standards by contributing to code reviews and help the team deliver more robust, maintainable and high quality software.       Execution Leadership   : In addition you are also responsible for generating energy in the execution of the project by planning and prioritization of the backlog, allocation of assignments to team members, tracking the execution of the project, and mitigating any risks.      You will be collaborate closely with other stakeholders like Product Management, SRE/DRE Teams, Security and Delivery teams to determine feasibility and scope of execution as well as maintain relationships with partner teams for dependencies.       People Leadership:    Finally and most importantly you are responsible for delivering success through people leadership.      We expect the Engineering Manager will model the right culture attributes (growth mindset) values (integrity, accountability, respect) for the team members to follow, coaching the team to be independent leaders and Caring for the team members needs, aligning the work with their aspirations for career development.      What you ll bring:      15+ years of proven work experience as an Engineering Manager or similar role handling engineering team(s) that built large scale software applications     Has been a proficient hands-on manager by staying in touch with the code, frameworks, architectures, and other technical details to evaluate team approaches.     Well-versed in secure programming practices, including experience with scanning tools like Veracode to ensure robust security measures      Demonstrated aptitude for collaboration across various engineering disciplines, including Software, Site Reliability, Performance,Database Reliability, and Quality Assurance.      Experience with cloud platforms like AWS, GCP, Azure for deploying and scaling applications.      Solid understanding of Scrum / Kanban framework     Analytical skills for evaluating information carefully and solving complex problems     Past experience in windows application development using ASP .NET / C# WWF, WPF frameworks while not mandatory is an added advantage.     Communication skills for overseeing staff and working with other management personnel     Detail-oriented with the ability to catch minor errors which can result in major problems     Ability to do project estimation, decomposition, commitment setting, and execution     Everbridge Engineering Landscape      Java, Scala, C#, ASP .Net     Springboots, WWF, WPF     Jenkins, GitHub CI-CD, TFS     Python, Shell scripting      MySQL,MS SQL, redis, sqllite      Streaming: Kafka, MS MQ     FedRAMP compliance

column2: UKG is looking for a Cloud Platform Engineering Manager to manage an agile scrum team of Platform Engineers that build and maintain our public/private clouds PaaS layer (Platform as a Service). This is a specialized team that abstracts the complexities of Infrastructure, Networking, Access, and Security requirements to ensure they are consumed in standardized ways for supporting Applications. These services are built in Linux leveraging various technologies including Go, Ansible, Concourse, K8s, GKE, Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and Openstack, to name a few. This position will partner with our Agile development teams and other Cloud teams to assure smooth integration and deployment of UKG software across the entire cloud infrastructure.  You will be collaborating with engineering leads across the organization to help research, design, prototype and operationalize solutions, ensuring that they align with UKG guidelines and industry best practices. In addition to this you will communicate with and mentor teams on best practices and guidelines regarding the best use of our tooling and services. Job Responsibilities: Partner with the Product Management team to meet or exceed all committed Product timelines for the teams, while planning the future roadmap Manage quality of product KPI, manage SLA of the team, and drive continuous improvement Create EPICs and Stories for teams to execute on  Report periodically on the status of the project, raising up major impediments or risks Work with individuals to set appropriate, challenging development goals Provide actionable feedback and opportunities to team member to lead them to high performance Create strong team morale and spirit, defining success in team terms and sharing wins and successes  Some (infrequent) on-call responsibilities will be required  Qualifications 10+ years managing high performance scrum teams of 5 individuals or more  10+ years of experience building and/or configuring cloud infrastructure and services (on-prem or public) through code  10+ years of experience with Cloud Native solutions (GCP, AWS, and/or Azure) 10+ years of experience with at least one programming language (e.g. Java/Golang/Ruby/Python)  Experience working with container technologies (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes)  Experience with one or more distributed version control/Source Code Management (SCM) technology and its workflows like git and the understanding of the gitops/devops mindset.  Experience developing, deploying, and maintaining highly availableservicesat scale Knowledge of Infrastructure test automation Experience with web technologies utilizing Microservices, SOA patterns and REST
column11: Cloud Platform Engineering, Golang, Java, Azure, Microservices, Infrastructure test automation, Docker, GCP, Source Code Management, AWS, Ruby, SOA patterns, Python, Kubernetes

column2: We are seeking an experienced and driven Engineering Manager with hands-on expertise to build and lead a high-performing team responsible for ensuring our applications are delivered seamlessly, perform optimally, and withstand unexpected challenges. You will play a pivotal role in defining and implementing strategies across these critical areas, fostering a culture of excellence and innovation. This is a hands-on role, and you would be required to design and implement the solutions.                        Responsibilities:                         Lead and develop a high-performing team:    Recruit, motivate, and develop a talented team of engineers specializing in    release engineering,     performance engineering   , and    resiliency engineering   . Foster a collaborative and inclusive environment where team members can thrive and contribute their best work.                    Own the release engineering process:    Design, implement, and continuously improve our release pipelines and procedures from creating release branches, merging changes & deploying code to test and production environments. Ensure releases are executed efficiently, reliably, and with minimal risk. Champion automation across the release process, leveraging tools and technologies to streamline workflows and reduce manual effort.                    Champion performance engineering:    Establish performance goals and metrics, identify, and address performance bottlenecks, and ensure applications meet defined performance standards. Continuously optimize application performance for scalability and speed. Build automation capabilities to improve efficiencies and provide faster feedback.                    Champion resiliency engineering:    Design and implement tooling & strategies to build robust and resilient systems that can withstand failures and unexpected events. Implement chaos engineering and fault injection practices to proactively identify and mitigate potential issues.                    Collaborate cross-functionally:    Partner closely with Development, QA, Operations, and other teams to ensure alignment and deliver successful releases. Advocate for best practices across release, performance, and resiliency engineering within the organization.                    Track and measure success:    Define and monitor key metrics for release performance, application performance, and system resiliency, identifying and addressing areas for improvement.                Stay ahead of the curve:    Continuously learn and stay updated on the latest trends and technologies in release engineering, performance engineering, and resiliency engineering. Advocate for best practices and implement innovative solutions.                    Required Skills:                         Technical Skills:                 Hands-on experience in designing, implementing, and managing release pipelines in automated fashion.              Deep understanding of code branching strategies              Deep understanding of Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) principles and practices              Strong knowledge of release automation tools (e.g., Jenkins, Helm Charts, GitHub actions)              Experience with programming languages (Java preferred)              Solid understanding of performance engineering principles and methodologies (profiling, load testing, optimization)              Deep knowledge of resiliency engineering practices (e.g., fault tolerance, disaster recovery)              Hands on Experience with distributed cloud platforms liked Docker, Kubernetes              Experience with chaos engineering and fault injection practices & tools (Chaos Monkey, Gremlin)                  Soft Skills:                 Excellent communication, collaboration, and leadership skills              Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.              Strong problem-solving and analytical skills              Attention to detail and commitment to quality.                Proven ability to manage multiple priorities and stakeholders.                 Benefits include:             Competitive base salaries              Bonus incentives              Support for financial-well-being and retirement              Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and disability benefits (depending on location)              Flexible working model with hybrid, onsite or virtual arrangements depending on role and business need              Generous paid parental leave policies (depending on your location)              Free access to global on-site wellness centers staffed with nurses and doctors (depending on location)              Free and confidential counseling support through our Healthy Minds program              Career development and training opportunities

Declare absolute readiness for 5x load. column2: We re looking for a      for a Manager, Quality Engineering to join the engineering leadership team. As Quality Engineering Manager, you will lead a team of talented, dynamic and passionate SDETs (Software Development Engineer in Test) in our Core Quality Engineering team that focuses on designing, enhancing and maintaining the Fivetran test automation and benchmarking frameworks.              You will work with product managers, engineering managers, support engineers, developers and resiliency engineering team to deliver high quality products.          The team s overall goal will be to build the tools and technology for the engineering group that accelerate the delivery of new features in an agile environment while safeguarding the high quality our customers expect from Fivetran products.                          Technologies You ll Use    :                    Java17, JUnit4          Docker and Kubernetes          AWS, GCP          Looker, Sigma, NR,          Terraform          Bazel, BuildKite                  As an Manager, Quality Engineering at Fivetran, you will:                      Build, lead and coach a team of highly performant SDETs.          Steer the vision, strategy, technical roadmap for the Quality Engineering team that aligns with the broader development and product team s goals.          Be a catalyst to promote Quality First mindset throughout the cross-functional organization          Develop deep expertise in product and provide functional and technical direction to automation team members          You will help prioritize work for your team, making difficult tradeoffs on design based on business constraints, ensuring on-time deliverables and high-quality software          You will diagnose and resolve obstacles that prevent your team from delivering high-quality software          Contribute to process improvement and establishing best practices for testing          You will regularly communicate with senior management on status, risks and change control.                  What you bring to the table:                      Proven track record as an IC delivering high quality software, with management experience          Experience building the roadmap that focuses on delivering tools to the engineering team which will enable the teams to ship high quality products.          Experience leading and growing a quality focussed team          Ability to motivate people, instill accountability, and optimize to attain the business goals. column2: Role: Copado Release Manager   Experience: 5+ Years Location: PAN India   Shift: UK Shift (1:00 pm to 10:00 pm) IST   We are seeking an experienced Copado Release Manager with a strong background in  Salesforce to lead our release management efforts. Environment Management: Manage Salesforce environments across the development  lifecycle, including sandbox, testing, and production environments. Change Management: Implement effective change management practices to assess the  impact of proposed changes and ensure proper governance. column2: As a leading technology innovator, Qualcomm pushes the boundaries of whats possible to enable next-generation experiences and drives digital transformation to help create a smarter, connected future for all. As a Qualcomm Software Engineer, you will design, develop, create, modify, and validate embedded and cloud edge software, applications, and/or specialized utility programs that launch cutting-edge, world class products that meet and exceed customer needs. Qualcomm Software Engineers collaborate with systems, hardware, architecture, test engineers, and other teams to design system-level software solutions and obtain information on performance requirements and interfaces.                           ?         Minimum Qualifications:         Bachelors degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 4+ years of Software Engineering or related work experience.    OR   Masters degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 3+ years of Software Engineering or related work experience.   OR   PhD in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 2+ years of Software Engineering or related work experience.     2+ years of work experience with Programming Language such as C, C++, Java, Python, etc               Job Overview              Join a new and growing team at Qualcomm focused on advancing state-of-the-art in Machine Learning.     The team uses Qualcomm chips extensive heterogeneous computing capabilities and engineers them to allow the running of trained neural networks on device without a need for connection to the cloud.      Our inference engine is designed to help developers run neural network models trained in a variety of frameworks on Snapdragon platforms at blazing speeds while still sipping the smallest amount of power.      See your work directly impact billions of mobile devices around the world.       As an AI SW Product Release Manager, you will play a key role in ensuring the successful delivery of our?     cutting-edge AI inference engine SDK.          You will be responsible to the AI SW product team for ensuring the continuity of?     effective delivery of product and will collaborate closely with development teams, QA teams, and stakeholders to?     drive efficient software releases.          Your role involves helping to resolve issues that could otherwise impede the      progress of the release. Your focus will be on timely releases, quality assurance, and seamless coordination across teams.                 Responsibilities:             Release Planning and Coordination:             Work closely with product leads, development & QA teams to plan and schedule SDK releases.         Coordinate release activities, ensuring alignment with project timelines.             Cross-Functional Collaboration:             Collaborate with product leads, development, and testing teams to ensure smooth execution of SDK releases.             Risk Management and Quality Assurance:             Identify potential risks and obstacles that may impact release schedules and communicate them with product leads and other stakeholders.         Implement strategies to mitigate risks and ensure high-quality deliverables.         Monitor and track release progress, addressing any deviations promptly.             Deployment and Communication:             Oversee the deployment of SDK releases, ensuring they meet quality standards.         Communicate release status, updates, and any critical information to relevant teams.         Maintain clear documentation related to each release.             Process Optimization:             Continuously improve processes, aiming for efficiency and effectiveness.         Explore opportunities for automation and streamlined workflows.             Agile Methodologies and Best Practices:             Apply agile methodologies to manage releases effectively.         Foster a culture of continuous improvement within the team.                 Qualifications:             bachelors/Masters degree in a relevant field (Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent).         Proven experience as a Release Manager, Delivery Manager, or similar role.         Experience working in agile delivery teams including scrum or Kanban based delivery activities.         Experience of leadership of team delivering software development       Working knowledge of Software Development Lifecycle     Prior development skills in C++, Python environments and well versed in version control tools like git and f   amiliarity with DevOps practices and tools.       Experience & understanding of embedded systems SW development or equivalent.     Understanding of Deep Learning fundamentals and    knowledge of AI technologies and SDK development is a plus.       Excellent communication skills (verbal, presentation, written)     Ability to collaborate across a globally diverse team and multiple interests.

column2: We are looking for a highly skilled and motivated Engineering Manager to join our development team and manage a team of highly skilled and motivated engineers that would design and build integrations between enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems and eCommerce platforms for our innovative tax compliance solutions.               Responsibilities               Performance Objectives               Here are some of the things we expect you to do when you join us:                                     Integrations and Connectors       : Dig into our cloud native Avalara product suite. We are looking to build and expand our market penetration through an extensive suite of integrations and connectors through a flexible, extensible platform capable of handling any source platforms. At the same time, we want to expose all the tax nuances through our integrations. Help us build and manage the team building this while maximizing performance, scalability and reliability and making it oh-so-simple to operate.                   Automation vs People Power       : Computers are great for process automation but there is a limit to what it can do, and you know where that limit is. You will tackle the unique challenges that occur at the intersection of software and people driven tasks and apply these solutions to the novel business automation that Avalara aims to create.                       Industry Leadership       : Avalara is the market leader, and we intend on staying that way. That means we cannot be complacent. We actively encourage everyone to make bold moves and keep testing their limits. We expect you to innovate and produce innovative ideas to make things better.                   You are not just another engineer when you join Avalara. You + Avalara equal endless possibilities!                           Develop and execute a comprehensive integration strategy for connecting our tax-based solution with a range of ERPs and eCommerce platforms.                     Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align integration efforts with overall product and business goals.                 Lead, mentor, and inspire a team of skilled engineers, providing guidance on best practices, architecture, and development methodologies.                 Foster a culture of innovation, collaboration, and accountability within the engineering teams.                 Leverage your deep understanding of ERP systems (e.g., SAP, Oracle, Microsoft Dynamics) and eCommerce platforms (e.g., Shopify, Magento, WooCommerce) to design and implement robust integrations.                 Ensure seamless data flow and real-time synchronization between systems, minimizing latency and ensuring data integrity for an ever-growing client-base and increasing data volumes.                     Drive the design and development of high-quality, scalable, and maintainable integration solutions.                 Oversee the full software development lifecycle, from requirements gathering and design to implementation, testing, deployment, and post-release support.                  Build POCs to demonstrate the technical solution feasibility.                 Focus on security aspects, observability, scalability, and telemetry.                 Perform code reviews and ensure coding standards and practices are followed.                     Implement and follow agile/scrum processes.               Qualifications             Bachelor/masters degree in computer science or equivalent                 15+ years of full stack experience in software design and development, with a proven track record of successfully leading teams in building integrations with ERPs and eCommerce platforms.                     Exceptional leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.                 Good understanding of Object-oriented programming languages                 Good understanding of ERP and eCommerce system architectures, APIs, data models, and authentication mechanisms.                 Good experience with RESTful APIs, JSON, XML, and other data interchange formats.                 Familiarity with authentication protocols like OAuth and token-based authentication.                     Experience in working in an Agile team with hands on with TDD, BDD                 Excellent problem-solving skills and a demonstrated ability to navigate complex technical challenges.                 Experience of working on AWS Cloud and DevOps (Terraform, Docker, ECS, etc.) would be beneficial.                 Excellent analytical and troubleshooting skills to be able to solve complex problems and critical production issues.                 Proven track record of delivering high-quality software projects on time.

column2: As a Migration Engineer you will play a critical role in ensuring a smooth transition of customers monitoring and observability infrastructure. Your expertise in various other observability tools, coupled with a strong understanding of PromQL, will be essential in successfully migrating alerts and dashboards, optimizing system performance, and enhancing the customers monitoring capabilities. You will collaborate with the customers cross-functional teams, understand their requirements, design migration strategies, execute the migration process, and provide training and support throughout the engagement.     Responsibilities:       Migration Strategy: Develop a comprehensive plan for migrating customers existing alerts and dashboards to Coralogix, considering system requirements, dependencies, and potential impact on existing infrastructure.         Alert Configuration: Configure and fine-tune alerting rules, thresholds, and conditions in Coralogix based on the customers existing alerts, ensuring an accurate translation of monitoring logic.         Dashboard Migration: Migrate the customers dashboards to Coralogix, reimagine visualizations, and ensure data accuracy, consistency, and optimal performance in the new environment.         Documentation: Create detailed technical documentation and guides for the migration process, including step-by-step procedures, best practices, and troubleshooting guidelines tailored to the customers environment.         Training and Support: Provide training sessions and workshops to educate the customers stakeholders on the usage of Coralogix, including configuring alerts, building dashboards, and leveraging PromQL for advanced querying and analysis.         Collaboration: Collaborate closely with the customers cross-functional teams, including DevOps, Engineering, and Operations, to understand their specific monitoring needs, gather requirements, and ensure alignment during the migration process.         Troubleshooting: Investigate and resolve issues related to alerts, dashboards, and overall monitoring functionality in Coralogix, ensuring the systems reliability and accuracy for the customer.         Innovational Mindset: We want your innovative skills and mindset to improvise and scale the process of migration through automation whenever possible.     Requirements      Management Experience (Systems Engineer, DevOps Engineer teams) - At least 2 years.         Professional Experience: Minimum of 8 years of experience as a Systems Engineer, DevOps Engineer, or similar roles, with a focus on monitoring, alerting, and observability solutions.         Observability Expertise: Good knowledge and hands-on experience with 2 or more Observability platforms, including alert configuration, dashboard creation, and infrastructure monitoring.         PromQL Proficiency: Good understanding and practical experience with PromQL, Prometheuss query language, for querying metrics and creating custom dashboards. Person would also need to learn Dataprime and Lucene syntax on the job.         Monitoring Concepts: Solid understanding of monitoring concepts, methodologies, and best practices, including alerting strategies, metric collection, and log analysis.         Troubleshooting Skills: Excellent problem-solving and debugging skills to diagnose issues, identify root causes, and propose effective solutions.         Communication Skills: Strong English verbal and written communication skills to collaborate with the customers cross-functional teams, deliver training sessions, and create clear technical documentation.         Analytical Thinking: Ability to analyze complex systems, identify inefficiencies or gaps, and propose optimized monitoring solutions.         Availability: Ability to also work across US and European timezones         This is a work from office role
column11: Training, Automation, Analytical, devops, Debugging, Troubleshooting, Risk management, Analytics, Monitoring, Technical documentation

column2: Autodesk Fusion is the first 3D CAD, CAM, CAE, and PCB tool of its kind, unifying design, engineering, electronics, and manufacturing to connect your entire product development process into one cloud-based platform     We are growing our Fusion 360 Manufacturing Data Model (MFGDM) team in Pune, and looking for an Engineering Manager to join our team who will manage a scrum team including developers and test developers from Senior to junior     MFGDM is the foundation of Manufacturing Cloud and core Data Framework for Autodesk Cloud Flagship Product - Autodesk Fusion     Our objective is to build manufacturing data model and cloud services to shift from traditional monolithic file to granular data and then to enable concurrency, integration, automation and collaboration throughout the entire product lifecycle with granular data, making it possible to empower customers to design and make better products faster     The team we are growing in Pune will focus on building fundamental data extraction pipeline in MFGDM, defining the data model and building related services to extract valuable data assets and establish data centricity, hence enabling product team using the granulized data to fulfil critical customer workflows, building insights from the data, and releasing full values buried in files     The team will develop data extraction solutions and services     The team need collaborate with other MFGDM teams in Canada, Pune and with extended teams cross GEOs     Now, we are an autonomic, T-shape group     The whole team effort is an essential part for achieving corporate data strategy and winning the race to the next gen Design Manufacturing Platform     If you are profoundly passionate about building, running, and overseeing resilient Data services and platforms utilizing a variety of Cloud technologies, then this position will be a perfect landing for you! This position will report to Senior Manager, Software Development and this is a hybrid position in Pune                                       Responsibilities           Recruit, coach and develop an effective team to deliver data services solution and features to internal consumers and external customers         Accountable for business outcomes for the teams. This is an incredibly exciting team to join as we expand globally. column2: MCO develops its platform using the Scrum methodology. In our model the Scrum Team Manager is the heart of every Scrum team. The role combines Scrum Manager and Team Manager responsibilities and is key for ensuring a high performing team where people perform their best and produce high quality software for our world beating SaaS platform.      The Scrum Team Manager has a deep interest in business success, can create a winning culture, leading a team to deliver the high quality, customer focused software services required.      You are an independent thinker, driven and motivated, who stands for quality and commitment to building real expertise. You are personable and appreciate the importance of team.      Responsibilities       The STM is a natural leader and can inspire their team to take on new challenges      The STM creates a productive environment where team members own the product and enjoy working on it      The STM, in conjunction with the Product Owner, will ensure that the team has a steady flow of suitable work and a well-formed planning and forecasting model in pace.      The STM will ensure each project has a well-defined scope and timeline      Coordinate sprints, retrospective meetings and daily stand-ups      Coach team members in Agile frameworks and best practice adoption      Facilitate internal communication and effective collaboration      Work with product owners to handle backlogs and new requests      Resolve conflicts and remove obstacles that occur      Ensure deliverables are up to quality standards at the end of each sprint and ensure that Quality actions are taking place peer-reviews, design-reviews, deliverable sign-off, comprehensive unit, integration and regression testing, etc.      Ensure JIRA is accurate and maintained including a well-groomed backlog, time recording is happening, team membership is maintained, team capacity is maintained      Ensure that developers are merging high quality software into the codebase, and that any build issues are immediately addressed      Ensure that team metrics are up-to-date and being used to implement improvements in team performance      Be responsible for the performance management of all individuals in the team (7 people normally)      Ensure each person s career development is being supported, regardless of their role in the team          Requirements and skills       Good with people and interested in helping people and teams achieve their best      Experience in software development as a software engineer, or quality engineer or Product Owner.      Excellent knowledge of Scrum techniques and artifacts (such as definition of done, user stories, automated testing, backlog refinement)    Excellent communication and servant leadership skills    Problem-solving and conflict-resolution ability      Outstanding organizational skills    Degree in Computer Science, Business or similar field Scrum master certification is a plus
column11: Automation, Performance management, Conflict resolution, Agile, Regression testing, Scrum, JIRA, Forecasting, Software services

column2: The Manager of Enterprise Systems Engineering is responsible for leading a cross-functional team of engineers who establish, build and support enterprise software applications     This is a technical leadership role that will engage in the most difficult and long-standing technical problems affecting Motive s business operations from top of the funnel through order processing, customer support and experience, billing, revenue and more     Successful candidates will have extensive enterprise systems experience and be a strategic thought leader with a focus on transformation and scalability             What Youll Do:       Reporting to the Director of Enterprise Systems, this role leads an Agile engineering operation that designs and implements scalable technical solutions for Lead to Cash systems which today include Salesforce, Salesforce packages and integrated solutions like Zuora, RevPro, Vertex, Boomi, Netsuite, and more     Lead a motivated cross-discipline team of Enterprise Systems Administrators, Developers,QA, Netsuite Admins and Test Automation engineers in maintaining the portfolio of enterprise applications and integrations.      Guide teams in innovative use of cloud-based technology solutions, including configuration of Salesforce platform components, AppExchange packages, creation of complex data models, integration with external systems, and custom code or workflows as necessary, to solve business requirements.      Commitment to continuous improvement. Working to improve communication, collaboration and alignment amongst teams inside and outside of the organization.      Work with the technical teams to establish best practices, standards and operational guidelines, with focus on platform reliability and serviceability.      Be the subject matter expert in driving the industry best practices for the L2C ecosystem and associated integrated tools. Stay current on L2C system releases, new features, product roadmaps and applications available from 3rd parties.     Collaborate with Product Management, the business and key IT stakeholders to plan, prioritize, and schedule applications development and enhancement requests, while providing direction and guidance to the applications development staff.     Deliver quality applications and support within a SOX compliance control environment with change management.      Accountable for availability and performance of applications portfolio, including ownership of incidents and release management     Provide oversight in standards adherence through reviews of project work including detailed technical specifications and application code           What Were Looking For:       MS/BS degree in Computer Science with at least 3 years management or leadership experience in this field.      2+ years as Application Architect or equivalent level of engineer, independently designing and delivering complex projects in multiple Salesforce technologies (e.g. Sales/CRM, Service, CPQ, Commerce).     Proven experience in managing onshore/ offshore models with a hybrid of vendors/consultants and FTEs.      Deep experience from the top of the LeadGen funnel, through Opportunity, CPQ, fulfillment, and Cash processes in a SaaS recurring revenue company.     Strong understanding of Security best practices including Salesforce Security model, Threat modeling, and least privileged / zero trust access models     Hands-on experience in Salesforce configuration / customization using Apex, Visualforce, Triggers, Scheduled and Batch classes, Lighting web components (LWC).      Ability to create an environment for honest and open discussion to resolve critical issues by collaborating with team members.      Excellent spoken and written communication skills with ability to present complex ideas in a clear, concise fashion to technical and non-technical audiences.      Ability to deal with ambiguity and thrive in a rapidly changing business environment.      Experience with Devops and Source Code management Tools     Experience with Agile methodologies, including scrum and continuous integration environments (Copado, Gearset, Autorabit etc). Proven experience in Agile process improvement.      Experience with integrating Salesforce.com with 3rd party applications using SOAP/REST API, Middleware, etc.      Salesforce Certified Application Architect or Certified System Architect preferred.

Allocate time for code review, refactoring and tech debt elimination over feature delivery. column2: This position offers a great opportunity to work on industry leading semiconductor devices, targeted for broad applications in Automotive and Industrial markets     In this role, you ll be a member of New Product Development team, tasked to work on new product development from design inception to manufacturing release     You will work in a cross-functional team, to drive low-cost test solutions for complex Analog / Mixed Signal ICs, using Advantest and Teradyne ATE platforms     Knowledge and experience with software development using of C++ / C / Python / JAVA is necessary     Candidate should know ATE platform architecture and programming language to develop low level ATE code for Analog / Mix Signal blocks     End goal is to design and productize deep Analog and Mix Signal test automated solutions, enabling organization benchmarks in quality, efficient code, and test-cost goals     As a member of Product Test Engineering Team, you will own, participate, lead, and drive below activities:     1. Primary responsibilities:     1. Define product DFT and test requirements Pre-PG including: a) DfT-max Requirements for a new product b) translate PRD / MRDs into PTS / SCMs / PRPs for ATE test-plan definition c) design ATE HW for lowest cost solution (max multi-site, lowest pin-mux) for Si bring-up and validation     2. Post-Si bring-up and validation of all functional and test features. This includes extensive debug that will require good knowledge of IC design and semiconductor physics, with ability to clearly isolate and root-cause issues to design margins and/or sensitivies to wafer-fab process and parametric parameters.     3. Execute design-of-experiments with process window corner lot to establish spec compliance of each product across full wafer-fab process window.     4. Execute qualification cycles for Si and package to automotive, industrial, and commercial standards (as per the primary product market)     5. During these various stages of Post-Silicon validation, you will interact with various cross-functional teams such as Design, DfT, Design Validation, Program Management, QRE/CQE, and Bench Characterization and Apps development teams     6. Will actively own or be part of a team that owns ATE Test Solutions, including HW design, socket design, ATE Resource Allocation, Board Schematic, Layout, and Diagnostic code     7. Will own product from bring-up to RTM (~12-14mo) and also own all the Product Entitlement goals and critical metrics for a successful ramp     2. The candidate, in this role, is expected to lead and assist in defining and writing up test-specs for automation as well as STML (standard test methods library) to be used across multiple ATE tester platforms.     3. Document gaps, lessons learned, and best practices with Design DFT teams to address on future products
column11: C++, Semiconductor, DFT, Diagnostics, Analog, Mixed signal, Test planning, Automotive, Python, Recruitment

column2: The ideal candidate should possess exceptional leadership skills, a deep understanding of system design principles, and extensive hands-on experience with Java and other relevant technologies. As an Engineering Manager, you will be responsible for mentoring and guiding the engineering team, driving technical excellence, and contributing to the design and implementation of highly scalable and complex systems.   Key Responsibilities:   ??Provide strong leadership and mentorship to the engineering team, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous learning. ??Lead the design, architecture, and implementation of highly transactional, large relational, and complex systems. ??Drive the adoption of best practices in system design, including microservices architecture, NoSQL databases, and various communication protocols such as REST, message queues, and RPC. ??Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define technical requirements, prioritize tasks, and deliver high-quality solutions on time. ??Stay updated with emerging technologies and industry trends, and advocate for their adoption where applicable. ??Ensure the scalability, reliability, and performance of systems by conducting thorough analysis and implementing optimizations as needed. ??Oversee the production and cloud architecture, with a deep understanding of AWS services and best practices. ??Conduct regular performance evaluations, provide constructive feedback, and support the professional growth and development of team members. ??Actively participate in recruitment efforts, including interviewing and onboarding new engineering talent.   Requirements:   ??Exceptional leadership skills with a proven ability to mentor and inspire engineering teams. ??Proficiency in system design principles, with a deep understanding of distributed systems. ??Extensive hands-on experience with Java, Linux, Apache, MySQL, Redis, RDBMS, JavaScript etc. ??Strong familiarity with microservices architecture, NoSQL databases, and various communication protocols. ??Exposure to functional programming and/or event-driven programming paradigms. ??Solid understanding of object-oriented design, data structures, algorithm design, and complexity analysis. ??9-12 years of experience in a product/services company, with some experience in managing a team. ??Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field from a reputable institution.   Nice to Have:   ??Experience with containerization technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes. ??Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and automation tools. ??Familiarity with agile methodologies such as Scrum or Kanban.

column2: Job Title: Director of Engineering Location: Gurgaon (Work form office) Shift Timings: 2:00 PM-11:00 PM (IST) Director of Engineering leads the engineering group; that includes front end, back end, full stack engineers, QA Engineers, and AI/ML Engineers. They lead and manage key activities in the engineering department inclusive of reliability engineering, and process automation in support of daily site/software development projects.Director of Engineering oversees all activities of the staff, builds reliability-engineering capabilities, and manages the variety of 3rd party tools and licenses related to the engineering activities. This role creates and maintains positive relationships with the internal and external stakeholders of the business in order to establish a consumer-focused culture.    Job Responsibilities:   Leadership/Supervisory Role:  The Director of Engineering manages the entire engineering department overseeing resources, staffing, and the enhancement and maintenance of a first-class team. He leads the development teams with a focus on technologies MERN, NoSQL, Cloud Platform, Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence. The Director of Engineering is also in charge of the management of technical integrations and relationships with internal stakeholders. This role also provides technical leadership for the implementation of features and site/software system enhancements. In their leadership capacity, the Director of Engineering develops, implements, and maintains site/software engineering standards and policies. They also acts as mentor to key development personnel, assisting in the execution of duties upon request, and readying these key personnel for the occupation of this position. Strategy:  The Director of Engineering collaborates with the CPO/CTO on the strategy, architecture, and development of the businesss site/software solutions. In this capacity they develop and implement software engineering strategies meant for the development of technological tools and processes required for current and future site/software development. The Director of Engineering organizes activities for the development, implementation, release, and maintenance of projects necessary for site/software development and sustenance. In this capacity, the Director of Engineering will also perform engineering design evaluations and ensure the completion of site/software projects within resource, budget, and scheduling restraints. Collaboration:  The Director of Engineering plays a highly collaborative role where they work closely with the senior product leadership in defining long-term organizational site/software strategies and roadmaps. In this collaboration they will also coordinate and communicates development activities and priorities with the senior product leadership in order to ensure the successful completion of project objectives. Knowledge:  The Director of Engineering takes initiative to explore, evangelize, and implement innovative technologies within the business in order to improve the businesss internal platforms as well as customer experience. They provides support and leadership to development departments, facilitating continuous evolution in both the frontend and backend development teams. This role also follows up on the business procedures, policies, and associated tools in order to develop processes that are more efficient and ensure conformity with the businesss policies and overall objectives. Other Duties: The Director of Engineering will also perform similar duties as he deems fit for the proper execution of his duties and duties as delegated by the Chief Product/Technology Officer or the Employer.   Required Qualification & Skills: Bachelors or Masters degrees in either computer Science or other disciplines of engineering 10+ years of experience in software product development, a majority of which is in web based solutions Experience in MERN stack applications (MongoDB, Express, React, Node) is required Experience in intent recognition engines like Google Dialogflow, SBERT, etc preferred Experience working with in memory databases such as Redis a plus Experience with growing and mentoring engineering staff a must Exposure to Core web fundamentals: HTML, JavaScript, and CSS, Skills in one or more chosen frameworks/libraries like jQuery or Bootstrap Good knowledge of the GIT version control system, ideally with GitLab Excellent problem solving, excellent interpersonal skills and analytical skills with exquisite attention to detail, ability to think strategically and logically Experience in writing and understanding automated unit test scripts and performing code reviews Proficient in agile software development methodologies Demonstrated creativity and initiative to improve products Excellent written and verbal communication skills    Desired Qualification & skills: Driving Organizational Goals Technical Hands-on Exposure to Micro services, API Service Registration and Discovery Good understanding of different open source libraries, tools
column11: Mern Stack, Leadership, Center Of Excellence, Strategy Making, database architecture, Artificial Intelligence, SBERT, AWS, Dialogflow, Machine Learning

column2: We are looking for an engineering manager in Pune to help us manage multiple development teams working on new features for the Frederick product at Mindbody. Frederick is a high growth product offering by Mindbody that allows business owners to market to their customers with email and text messages automations.     Engineers on the Frederick team work on several software applications across a microservices architecture, with full test coverage, continuous integration (CI), and continuous delivery (CD). Back-end development primarily utilizes Ruby-on-Rails, while front-end development primarily utilizes React.     The ideal candidate for this position has a strong background in software development and experience managing multiple development teams. To be successful in this role, you should be proficient in Rails and confident managing team and hiring while, at the same time, improving processes, setting goals and timelines for multiple projects.     What you bring to the team:        Bachelor s Degree in Computer Science or equivalent degree         12+ years of overall technical experience          3+ years managing and growing multiple distributed teams within an agile environment          5+ years of Rails experience and have owned the development, build, testing, and release process          Hands-on approach to working with engineers and willingness to get into the trenches with your team         Excellent English communication skills, can communicate professionally both verbally and in writing         Experience working within a micro-service and CI/CD environment         Detailed oriented, professional and positive work attitude           Day to day:        Lead the team on architecture decision making         Manage multiple teams of developers, ensuring continued growth and development for team members         Coordinate projects and initiatives between Pune and US teams         Motivate staff and provide technical direction and guidance, recognizing the role as that of both manager and mentor.         Perform some individual work and lead the team on architecture decisions         Help with recruiting and training new engineers.         Collaborate closely with QA, product, and other managers to ensure the successful completion of engineering deliverables       SCOPE OF SUPERVISION/AUTHORITY:        Duties for this position are performed under limited supervision         This role has a broad decision making authority within the scope of assignment         This position requires self-direction and continuous evaluation of priorities to ensure completion by deadlines         All decisions and consulting will reflect adherence with internal policies and state and federal law         This position plays a key role in recruiting, supervising, evaluating, mentoring and if necessary, dismissing team members         Although this role can operate successfully with little direct supervision, all operational changes particularly those relating to job function changes, raises, service level goals, and anything budget related must be agreed upon by the department Executive       WORK ENVIRONMENT AND PHYSICAL DEMANDS:        You will need dexterity of hands and fingers to operate a computer keyboard         This position is mostly stationary and will be required to remain stationary for extended periods of time         Specific vision abilities required by this position include close vision, color vision, and the ability to adjust focus         The noise level in the work environment is usually moderately quiet

column2: Overview The GBS Digital Factory is the digital transformation engine for PepsiCo that sits within the Global Business Services (GBS) organization. It focuses on the re-imagination and digitization of capabilities, processes, services, and reporting for the Enterprise through the design, development, and deployment of digital products and solutions, having a direct impact to the overall PepsiCo P&L. As an Intelligent Automation Developer, you will be collaborating with other Developers to execute the design, development, testing, and delivery of automation and cognitive end-to-end processes leveraging next generation technologies (e.g., RPA, Cognitive / AI, Optical Character Recognition, Intelligent Character Recognition, Content Translation and Computer Vision). Responsibilities Consults with business stakeholders, Product Designers and other developers within the GBS Digital Factory to understand the current state process, business requirements and business goals Execute the design, development, and deployment of intelligent automation solutions, including attended and unattended bots (e.g., using UiPath), configure robotics processes and objects using core workflow principles in an efficient manner Execute development of test scripts for digital products and play an active role in system integration testing (SIT) and user acceptance testing (UAT) Execute the maintenance of proper documentation (Process Design and Solution Design Documents PDD, SDD) for the solutions, test procedures and scenarios using UAT and production phase Consult with Enterprise Technology teams during code review sessions to validate code and receive approvals Consult with other developers and development leads teams to support production deployment efforts for digital products Execute on all data cleansing and validation activities prior to kick-off on development activities by the rest of the team Consult with senior Intelligent Automation developers to align on design choices for digital products, establish the technical vision, and analyze tradeoffs between usability, functionality, and performance needs Execute the creation of training manuals for business users regarding digital product operation and troubleshooting Execute surveillanceof digital products for KPIs, breaks, and defects and perform maintenance as requiredwithin the defined SLAs Consult with Intelligent Automation Lead to implement design and development standards for the GBS Digital Factory Qualifications Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Data Science or related field preferred 7-9 years overall experience; 3+ years professional experience working directly on the design and development of intelligent automation solutions;3+ years of experience building large scale automation solutions and maintaining data repositories Experience handling and transforming big data using data management tools (e.g., SQL) Certification and experience with various intelligent automation tools (e.g., UiPath) Experience with coding languages (e.g., Python, JavaScript. OpenCV) and next generation technologies (i.e., AI, ML, OCR, VR, Computer Vision / Image Processing, Deep Learning tools & techniques) Experience with agile development methodology (i.e., Safe Agile) Experience with cloud technologies (e.g., Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud, Amazon Web Services, and cloud-specific PaaS and SaaS solutions) Experience / involvement in organization wide digital transformations preferred Ability to work in a fast paced, agile environment with large cross-functional teams Ability to manage multiple priorities at the same time Exceptional quantitative and analytical skills Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, verbal and written Ability to drive initiatives from inception to delivery
column11: Python, JavaScript. OpenCV, Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud

column2: Job Description: Scrum Master Responsibilities: 1.	Guidance and Advocacy: Provide guidance to the team and organization on the effective utilization of Agile/Scrum principles and values. 2.	Assessment and Coaching: Evaluate the team's Scrum adoption level and coach them towards higher maturity levels while ensuring sustainability. 3.	Impediment Removal: Identify and eliminate impediments hindering the team's progress, or guide the team in removing them effectively. 4.	Creating Safe Environment: Cultivate a trusting and safe environment where team members feel comfortable raising issues, focusing on healing and collaborative problem-solving. 5.	Facilitation: Facilitate the team's workflow without assigning tasks or dictating work, promoting self-organization and accountability. 6.	Communication Support: Assist in internal and external communication processes, enhancing transparency, and ensuring information flow. 7.	Product Owner Support: Support and educate the Product Owner, particularly in backlog grooming and maintenance. 8.	Leading by Example: Provide unwavering support to the team and set a precedent through personal example, demonstrating commitment to Agile values. Required Skills/Experience: 1.	Certification: Certified Scrum Master (CSM) or Professional Scrum Master (PSM I). 2.	Experience: Minimum one year of experience in the Scrum Master role within a software development team. 3.	Leadership Skills: Proficient in servant leadership, facilitation, conflict resolution, continual improvement, empowerment, and transparency enhancement. 4.	Agile Knowledge: Familiarity with widely successful Agile practices such as User Stories, Test-Driven Development (TDD), Continuous Integration (CI), Continuous Testing, and Pair Programming. 5.	Technical Acumen: Understanding of the technologies utilized by the team, enabling effective communication and support. 6.	Team Leadership: Previous experience as a team lead for approximately five years, demonstrating leadership capabilities. Qualifications: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Engineering (B.E/B.Tech/M.E/M.Tech) or Computer Applications (MCA).

column1: Manager - Algorithm Developer Job @ Applied Materials
column2: Applied Materials , Inc. is the leader in materials engineering solutions used to produce virtually every new chip and advanced display in the world. The company provides manufacturing equipment, services, and software to the semiconductor, display, and related industries worldwide. Applied Materials was founded in 1967 and is headquartered in Santa Clara, California. Job Expectations The candidate will be responsible for leading a team of data scientists who provide analytics services for Applied Materials installed base support business. The deliverables include development of new service capabilities, piloting them, and commercializing them in partnership with service engineering. The team will work with field engineers and product engineering teams to understand the requirements, bring forward creative ideas, develop proofs-of-concept, architect, design, develop, and modify algorithms into production code, provide production support, and train end-users. The skill sets in the team include complex image processing, text processing, descriptive statistical analysis, predictive statistical analysis using AI/ML, data visualization and analytics process automation using Python, and data cleansing. Candidate should be willing to learn and adopt semiconductor industry as their career domain. Key Responsibilities Responsible for managing completion of assignments, projects and programs in algorithm development to support Applied's service business. Scope of algorithm development includes research, design, code development, implementation, and proliferation. Ensure correct assignment of developers to programs. Review and monitor progress to milestones on development programs. Develop roadmaps for algorithmic development programs. Oversee algorithmic concept and feasibility for algorithmic modules, including problem statement definition, data gathering, literature review, concept selection, risks, and implementation constraints. Oversee documentation of algorithmic development and deployment, including integration into required systems, user testing, and user training. Oversee software and hardware implementation. Interact with internal and external customers to define gaps, identify opportunities, define program scope and deliverables, and proliferate solutions to the user base. Present to management for project reviews, interact with project stake holders, run regular cadence meetings and work in alignment with team and organization goals. Responsible for technical development of team, objective setting, and performance management. Develop growth plan for the team, including identification of new areas of impact. Requirements  Preferred programming and data science skills include: Python, C++, Unix, Image Processing, Deep Learning, AI/ML, NLP, GenAI, Text Mining, Database Design and Management, Web Scraping, GPU Optimization. Proficient in business processes and software such as Microsoft Word/ Excel/ Powerpoint/ Teams, Atlassian JIRA and Confluence. Highly organized and detailed-oriented. Ability to build and maintain positive and productive inter-departmental working relationships. Ability to work in a cross-functional organization and multitask on multiple projects. Drive Subject Matter Experts to deliver programs on time and on budget. Excellent oral and written communication, organizational, analytical, and interpersonal skills. Interest in building a career in the semiconductor industry. Education Bachelors, Master??, or Ph.D. Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, or Engineering with a concentration in data science or AI/ML. Job: Engineering Job: Manager, Algorithm Developer Primary Location: Bangalore, India Travel: 10%, mostly international Job Summary Computer Science/ Mathematics/ Engineering background with >10 years of experience in performing statistical analysis, designing and developing Image Processing/ Computer Vision Algorithms using Python, handling and analyzing large volumes of data. Unix knowledge and/ or semiconductor background is an added advantage. Prior team leadership experience is an added advantage.
column11: Algorithm Development, AI/ML, Image Processing, Unix, GenAI, C++, Text Mining, Deep Learning, GPU Optimization, NLP, Database Design and Management, Web Scraping, Python

column2: We are looking to onboard an engineering manager for this team who has experience in managing a team of engineers along with development experience in backend and frontend technologies. This position is going to be based in Mumbai. We are working in a hybrid environment with flexibility to work from home or office as and when needed. In the initial phase we expect manager to spend more time in office so that they familiarize more with the team and Boku s culture.         ABOUT YOU:         Hands-on technical leader experienced working with large scale systems     Self-starter - You require minimal guidance     Growth-minded - You are curious and enthusiastic to expand your skills     Ownership - Your team is your business. You are confident, driven, self-motivated and quickly take ownership of your work.     Product minded - You enjoy working with stakeholders on requirement discovery and building out new features     Multiplier - You care about your engineers and are passionate about growing your team and building new leaders for Boku     People Management - You care about your engineers and their career progression. You want to ensure they have the right tools to do their job     Desire for impact - You are willing to take on more responsibilities as opportunities arise         RESPONSBILITIES:         Lead a team of 3-5 engineers that include hiring, performance management, career development, etc     Provide technical guidance, mentorship, and assistance to the team to effectively execute product roadmaps and build scalable, easy-to-use applications.     Collaborate cross functionally with Product, Design, and Operations team.     Interact with our merchants and partners stakeholders.     Work hands-on with a highly skilled team of engineers     Participate in all phases of the software development lifecycle, including design, development, testing and release     Be highly motivated and maintain a positive, can-do attitude in a fast-moving environment         QUALIFICATIONS   :       BS in Computer Science or related field with 5+ years of relevant engineering work experience.   2+ years of technical management experience.     Excellent written and verbal communication skills to document and explain technical design, best practices, and integration guide to both technical and non-technical audiences.     Ability to work collaboratively and effectively with a range of stakeholders     Able to thrive on a high level of autonomy and responsibility.     Attention to detail and strong organization skills     Strong software design and architecture skills     Experience building products that are hosted in the cloud (AWS, GCP, etc).     Experience with building mobile UI based applications     Experience with building service-oriented, database driven applications     Experience with Java or other OOP languages.     Experience with modern JavaScript framework, such as Vue.js, Angular, React, etc.     Experience with some (or all) of the following technologies/frameworks/tools: Maven, Git, MySQL, Spring, JPA/Hibernate, Jersey, Jetty, etc.     Experience using agile methodologies and tools     Experience working on high-volume and low-latency systems     Prefer: Has worked for a US-based company in the US or has exposures working with a US-based company.

column2: This role is responsible for the delivery of custom software solutions used by internal clients and IT team members and supervises a team in Mumbai. They will learn and incorporate Russell IT standards, tooling, and practices and will be driven to continuously improve Russell s software quality.              Years of Experience         5+ years of Software Development experience required.     3+ years of experience with CRM, Microsoft Dynamics strongly preferred             Qualifications         Tech lead experience/management skills preferred     Bachelor s degree in technical or business discipline, or equivalent work or education-related experience required.     Experience collaborating with multiple teams, including business unit teams, to deliver solutions through all phases of the SDLC required.     Full stack development experience including UI, web, middle-tier, and database required.     .NET, C#, SQL, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Service Oriented Architecture, and Web API experience required. Responsibilities         Mentor others on the team, help guide and advise as necessary     Liaise with Manager on building a high performing team and managing performance     Assist with the interviewing and selection of teammates      Deliver maintainable, testable, and reusable production quality code in a corporate financial environment using Agile development practices     Use technical expertise combined with business acumen to envision and implement solutions to strategic business challenges, thereby using technology to differentiate Russell Investments in the market.     Work directly with business units to implement features in existing software as well as to build new prototypes and software solutions     Optimize application performance and stability by anticipating, investigating, and resolving problems ahead of time     Conceptualize and be able to articulate solutions to team members and clients     Take responsibility for the analysis, design, coding, testing, debugging, and documentation of complex technical systems     Consistently find and deliver new ways to develop and improve processes and technologies     Act as a primary contact for users to address development questions and concerns     Perform additional duties as assigned     Perform all responsibilities in accordance with Russell Investments Core Competencies             Candidate Requirements         Prior experience of managing team of size 2-6 members     Experience collaborating with multiple teams, including business unit teams, to deliver solutions through all aspects of the SDLC required.
