column2: Who are we?           Were a technology company laser-focused on improving how people learn the language and behavioural skills they need to thrive in intercultural working environments.         Our global presence in 14 countries across three continents and a staff of 30 nationalities help us find solutions for enterprises to break down cultural barriers and unleash their international teams full potential. Around 400 Learnshippers globally have decided to join us already, and we hope that with your passion for languages, technology, and lifelong learning, you, too, will join us soon.         We are looking for a    Engineering Manager in Chennai    at the earliest possible starting date.         Therefore, please read the below description carefully and feel free to connect with your recruiter for any questions.         We cant wait to meet you!           What you will do here:                 Work with multiple product development teams of engineers to design, develop, and test products and components using an agile, scrum methodology.             Highly motivated self-starter who loves ownership and responsibility while working in a collaborative and interdependent team environment.             Responsible for creating and providing innovative solutions that meet not only functional requirements, but also performance, scalability, and reliability requirements.             Continue to build an effective development team, setting goals, mentor and do performance reviews of team members.             Delivery of quality applications on time and on budget             Management and execution against project plans and delivery commitments.             Follow the software engineering best practices and audit the process and improve the standards of the practices.             Build, Guide and Coach the Scrum Team on how to use Agile practices and principles to deliver high quality products, facilitate and support all scrum events.             Ensure security, availability, resilience, and scalability of solutions developed by the teams.             Drive and manage the bug triage process, represent development team in project meetings to ensure efficient testing and bug fixing process, and be an effective advocate for the development group.             What we re looking for:                 10+ years experience in Open-source technology like PHP, Python.             5+ years experience with relational DBs like SQL Server or MySQL.             Experience in any one of the PHP frameworks like Symfony / Zend / Drupal / Magento             Experience in working frontend frameworks like React JS / Angular JS             Experience in RESTful services, Microservice Architecture and Serverless Architecture.             Experience working with cloud environment like AWS / Azure.             Experience working within an Agile/Scrum and CI/CD environment.             Experience working with version control using GitLab / GitHub.             Experience in the design of new systems or redesign of existing systems to meet business requirements, changing needs, or newer technology.             5+ years experience leading a team of 10 or more engineers.             Experience or Knowledge of one or more Front-End frameworks will be a strong plus.             Experience or Knowledge with NoSQL Database like MongoDB will be a plus.             Experience or Knowledge with AI/Machine Learning is a plus.             Master s degree in computer science, Computer Engineering, or related technical discipline             Ability to handle multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment. column2: Lyktek.io is working with multiple Australian clients who are building web, mobile and embedded applications in e-commerce, analytics and smart home domains. We need a reliable captain to steer the application development efforts and upkeep our reputation as a dependable, collaborative, high quality technology partner .      This is a full-time, work-from-home position and we support flexible work arrangements as a core principle. Lyktek.io will cover all internet and mobile network expenses associated with work. Tasks                     Lead a high-performing team that will directly support our Azure customers online to resolve critical and complex technical issues in a 24x7x365 environment.          Strong operational rigor to deliver outstanding customer support resulting in exceptional customer satisfaction (CSAT).         Enable a customer obsessed environment where team members can relentlessly champion and advocate for our customers in representing their issues to engineering teams and be a change agent to develop innovative ways to resolve their issues.         Start-up mindset to experiment with new ideas and continuously evolve the MSX role to increase business impacts.          Create clarity and generate energy while leading teams through any changes.         Build a team culture that thrives on customer obsession, where team members go above and beyond their immediate issue at hand to delight the customers and can predict and resolve the next issue before the customer reports it. Work with Product Owner/Business Analysts to understand functional requirements and interact with other cross-functional teams to architect, design, develop, test, and release features. column2: ZL Tech seeking an experienced leader who possesses a unique balance of strong interpersonal skills, business acumen, experience with large-enterprise management consulting, and knowledge of digital/cloud transformation.      In this role, you will partner with customers, ZL Sales, and other teams to develop and execute highly scalable, flexible, and resilient solutions that address customer use cases. You will engage in a wide variety of projects for customers and partners, spanning diverse technologies across multiple industries, and help the world s largest enterprises successfully navigate the myriad changes to business and IT capabilities. You will lead customer engagement delivery and manage a multi-disciplinary team of Professional Service Engineers and Hosted Managed Services Engineers with diverse perspectives and experiences.      Additionally, this position will build and lead a global virtual Operations team responsible for incident management, monitoring, change management, and triage functions for ZL Tech solutions deployed in cloud environments (AWS, Azure).        Responsibilities         Engage customers - collaborate with sales leaders and professional service teams to develop strong customer and partner relationships and build a growing business     Build and lead great teams - attract top IT talent to build high performing teams of Engineers with superior domain depth, outstanding customer relationship skills, and a career focus on digital and change enablement capabilities.      Coach and teach - collaborate with field sales, pre-sales, training and support teams to help partners and customers learn and use ZL solutions and services     Deliver value - lead high quality delivery of a variety of customized engagements      Build organization assets - Design and roll out strategies and detailed plans that help companies evolve to a digitally fluent culture that support cloud transformation, and are aligned to best practices     Participate in business development, including proposals and customer relationships     Build the practice by helping with market research, thought leadership, capability development, sales enablement, and knowledge management     Deliver in methodology and mechanisms to enhance solution quality     Engage with customer stakeholders, consultants and contractors for project set up, delivery, and closure     Engage in a continuous feedback loop to inform ongoing innovation of solution offerings     Contribute to practice development initiatives including culture building, internal community involvement, eminence, recruiting, whitepapers, etc.     Lead and manage the daily engagement of the Operations Engineers to troubleshoot priority incidents, facilitate blameless post-mortems and ensure permanent closure of incidents     Identify application patterns and analytics in support of better service level objectives     Advocate and lead for the design of self-healing and resiliency patterns     Lead the design and architecture of automated software and product upgrades, change management, and release management solutions     Coach, mentor, support and manage the team as applicable     Participate in the 24x7 support coverage as needed         Requirements       Essential:       Bachelor s degree or equivalent experience     10 years of relevant work experience in consultative delivery and customer-facing roles, focused on enterprise customers     7 years of experience managing and delivering large-scale projects and support realms     Managed and delivered IT engagements for large, Enterprise customers     Proficiency in presenting to C-level executives (CIO, CEO, CTO, CISO, etc.) and technical subject matter experts     Analytical, able to work effectively in a matrixed organization, adept at managing multiple workstreams     Must enjoy spending time with customers (internal and external) to understand their needs, and to define innovative solutions that meet their requirements     Must be flexible and adaptable; able to work in ambiguous situations     Experience in Incident, Monitoring, Triage, Change Management     Experience of Cloud Environments (AWS, Azure)     Experience in Customer Support Roles     Exposure to managing an Incident Platform team or NOC     Proficiency in one or more technology domains, may be a cross-domain expert able to solve complex and mission-critical problems within a business or across the firm     Working knowledge of infrastructure components (e.g. routers, load balancers, cloud products, container systems, compute, storage, and networks)     Excellent debugging and troubleshooting skills         Preferred:         Previous Big Consulting experience     Possess Cloud certifications (Azure/AWS/GCP )     Understands the value proposition of the public cloud and has managed a cloud migration engagement (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS)     Experience with Agile Enterprise IT Management frameworks (e.g. SAFe , ITIL Sigma, Agile/SCRUM processes, etc.)

column2: Provide effective leadership to software engineering teams. Be a    bridge between the technical aspects of software development and the business    goals of the organization.        Desired Skills, Qualifications & Experience:       Relevant educational background such as Bachelor of Engineering or    master s in computer science      10+ years experience in India software industry with the last role    being a Software Engineering Manager or similar.     Experience in building products using Agile Scrum methodology.     Strong understanding and exposure working in software product-based    company.     A self-starter with a desire to work in a highly entrepreneurial    environment.     Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills.     Coming from technical background.     Knowhow of TFS (Azure DevOps).      Settled in Pune and open to working from office.       Nice to have traits:       * Originality in thought process.    * Exposure to the mobile app development.    * Deep insights into Product Development.    * Relevant company awards or LinkedIn recommendations. Job purpose:     Reporting to the Senior Software Engineering Manager, this person will be    responsible for the execution of the Software Development Lifecycle, to ensure    that the requirements laid out by the Product Management Team are delivered    within expected timescales and to the given specification laid out by the    business requirements. They will contribute towards the refinement of the    Software Development Lifecycle to drive efficiencies in the development    process. As one of the senior members in the product development team they    will be expected to contribute fully to the planning and execution of the plans    for Product Development and Support.     The Software Engineering Manager will be responsible for maintaining and    building upon our Agile approach to delivering software within a hybrid work    model best suited to the needs of the team and will be involved in the    alignment of approaches to ensure that accurate estimation of work results in a    predictable delivery of the product roadmaps/customer value during their    scheduled release cycles.      As a strong people manager, the Software Engineering Manager will be    responsible for ensuring that our engineering teams have a baseline set of    skills and competencies through appropriate training to allow the mobility of    resources between development projects within the division, as well as breaking    down product silos and geographical barriers to encourage a collaborative    working culture. They will also be responsible for ensuring that success is    measured and rewarded through a continual performance review process for both teams and individuals throughout the engineering function.       Job Responsibilities:       * A member of the Technical Management Team responsible for the maintenance    and adherence to the Software Development Lifecycle to ensure delivery of    product development projects within Group.    * Liaise with the Product Management Team to manage the resources required to achieve the product roadmaps considering recruitment, training and the    acquisition of tools and frameworks in a timely fashion to avoid delays in delivery.    * To report to the senior management on progress against active projects and    to highlight any areas of risks against project timelines that may impede the    engineering function s ability to deliver the product roadmaps.    * To be an advocate of the Agile development practices employed by the    development function and work with their peer group (other Engineering    Managers, Support Function and Delivery Function) to refine the process    employed by the function.    * To ensure that the engineering team are engaged in continuous professional    development through a structured review program that aims to identify    individual needs and issues in a timely fashion. Performance Criteria:     * Delivery of Product items on time    * Reduction in bugs found in live    * Achievement of SLAs for relevant software    * Hiring and retention of quality staff    * Continuous improvement How does this role compare with other managerial    roles:     In IT services companies, managerial roles such project manager, program    manager and delivery manager are more mainstream. Whereas in Software Product companies the Engineering Manger role is more prevalent. Here is a brief comparison between these roles. Being a software product company, we are looking for an Engineering Manager.      * Project/Program manager: Manages specific projects, overseeing planning,    coordination, and execution. Responsible for timelines, resources, project    risks and deliverables.    * Delivery manager: Focuses on successful delivery of software    products/solutions to clients. Manages end-to-end delivery process, resource    allocation, client relationships and coordination.    * Engineering/Development Manager: Leads and manages the engineering team.    Focuses on software engineering best practices, mentors team, collaborates with    product management and aligns technical solutions with business goals.

column2: This role is an opportunity for a technologist with a passion for Linux and Cloud technologies to build a career with Canonical and drive the success with those leveraging Ubuntu and open source products. If you have an affinity for open source development and a passion for technology, then you will enjoy working with some of the best people in the industry at Canonical.       Engineering Manager       The BootStack team designs, builds, and operates modern distributed systems on private infrastructure for customers. From Kubernetes to OpenStack and everything in-between, you ll be working with the latest technology in a fast-paced engineering environment. As a Cloud Engineering Manager for the BootStack team, you will be responsible for managing the engineers that oversee day-to-day Managed Service of customer environments, including customer service management, managed services operations and consistent product improvement engineering. Collaboration with customers, product engineering, and operations is critical to success.         As an Engineering Manager you will:         Manage a growing engineering team to optimise the quality and velocity of both development and operations     Identify and measure team health indicators     Implement disciplined engineering and operations processes     Represent the BootStack team with respect to stakeholders, customers, and external teams     Ensure proper team focus on priorities, milestones, and deliverables     Work to meet service level agreements with customer deployments around the globe     Deliver quality managed services in a consistent, timely manner         The successful Engineering Manager candidate will have:         Bachelors (or equivalent) education in a technology field     Proven track record of professional experience of either software delivery using Python, Go, C, C++, Java, or similar and/or managing operations teams     Proven experience with OpenStack     Demonstrated strong commitment to testing methodologies and maintainable code quality     Experience with Linux system administration, Ubuntu/Debian a plus     Strong communication and cooperation skills     Experience with agile software development methodologies     Experience working in and managing distributed teams     Technical aptitude for understanding complex distributed systems     Experience with cloud topologies and technologies     Travel ito team and company events and customer meetings, roughly 20% or less

column2: What we offer                 Fair compensation: We believe in providing competitive salaries that reflect the value and expertise of our team members.         Paid Leave: We understand the importance of work-life balance and offer generous paid leave to support our employees well-being and personal commitments.         Work-life balance: We prioritize creating a healthy work-life balance for our employees, recognizing the importance of maintaining personal and professional harmony.         Flexible Working: We offer flexible working arrangements to accommodate individual preferences and needs, enabling our employees to optimize their productivity and achieve a better work-life integration.         Activities events: We organize various activities and events to foster team bonding, creativity, and a positive work culture. These events provide opportunities for relaxation, celebration, and building connections within the DIAGNAL community.         Learning Development program: We are committed to the growth and development of our employees. Our learning and development programs offer continuous opportunities to enhance skills, acquire new knowledge, and stay updated with the latest industry trends.         Growth: We provide a platform for professional growth, enabling employees to take on new challenges, expand their skill sets, and advance their careers within DIAGNAL.         Talented People: We are proud to have a team of talented individuals who are passionate about their work and contribute to our collective success. Working alongside skilled professionals, you ll have the opportunity to learn, collaborate, and be inspired.         Collaboration: We foster a collaborative work environment where teamwork and open communication are valued. You ll have the chance to collaborate with cross-functional teams, including designers, project managers, QA engineers, operations engineers, third-party systems providers, and customers, to deliver exceptional products.         Impactful Products: Joining DIAGNAL means being part of a team that creates impactful products used by millions of users. Your work will have a direct influence on the digital entertainment industry and contribute to our mission of delivering high-quality experiences.         Freedom: We trust our employees and believe in providing them with the freedom to make decisions and execute their work without excessive micromanagement. We value autonomy and encourage independent thinking.         Feel valued: We genuinely value the contributions and efforts of our team members. We strive to create an inclusive and supportive environment where everyone feels valued, recognized, and appreciated.               Role           Demonstrate daily a fervent commitment to crafting exceptional software products and leading high-performing software development teams.         Display a genuine passion for both constructing and guiding an exceptional software development team.         Thrive in a fast-paced, cutting-edge technology environment by fostering innovation and managing day-to-day operations effectively.         Ensure timely, budget-conscious, and high-quality delivery of digital entertainment products and cloud systems that are used by millions of consumers.         Collaborate seamlessly with cross-functional and cross-cultural teams, including designers, architects, project managers, QA engineers, third-party system providers, and clients, to align efforts with company objectives.         Promote organizational knowledge through documentation, best practices, and training initiatives.         Champion the engineering of software solutions for long-term performance and maintainability, prioritizing quality over shortcuts.         Contribute insights to the product roadmap and enhancements of development methodologies.         Proactively identify and address potential organizational, procedural, and technical challenges before they arise.               Experience Required           Proven track record in recruiting, motivating, managing, and retaining high-performing software engineering teams, facilitating continuous learning and improvement.         Comprehensive understanding of quality processes critical for consistent delivery of top-notch software products with every release.         Hands-on development experience coupled with the ability to lead your team at a code and architecture level.         Proficiency in React, Kotlin, and optionally Swift.         Strong grasp of Agile software development and deployment lifecycle across diverse consumer devices, cloud services, and data center servers.         Proficiency in Git-based source code management, Continuous Integration, and JIRA configuration/task management.         Sound comprehension of contemporary internet technology stacks on both client and server fronts.         Familiarity with integration, security, scalability, high availability, performance optimization, monitoring, logging, and error handling best practices.         Solid knowledge and understanding of digital media domain systems, including video workflows, delivery, DRM, content management, ecommerce, payments, data analytics, and consumer device platforms.         Over 3 years of experience managing software engineering teams.         Over 6 years of hands-on enterprise/service provider-grade development experience.         Self-motivation and adept time management, ensuring consistently high international quality standards.         An engineering degree in computer science or equivalent practical experience.         Previous involvement in Media, E-commerce, Telecommunications, or a similarly large-scale, consumer-facing industry.

column2: We are looking for a top-notch HEAD OF ENGINEERING, for our pre-series-A client, headquartered in Ahmedabad. An enterprise SAAS-based product company that helps anyone build a Marketplace in minutes and connect with 1000s of Sellers on the world's largest Brand Directory.  Powering 650+ merchants across 50+ countries, this SaaS platform is fast, cheap and better than any other seller Central, thus saving millions of dollars for the sellers which they would otherwise invest in creating tech for onboarding vendors, building catalogues, managing orders, shipping, invoicing, commissions and reconciliation. This is an exciting opportunity to be part of the founding team transforming the way e-commerce operates across the world. You will witness the zero-to-one journey of a marquee investor-backed startup. You would have a full view of the business with a free hand to create a futuristic stack which scales to millions of users across the world. Tech stack : We work with different stacks like PHP+Laravel, MySQL, Vue.js, AWS, Redis, Node.js, Golang, Java, Python, and ReactJS. microservices written in other languages, integrations with RESTful APIs etc. Flexible on the stack to be used in the future.  Requirements :  1. You are a Btech, BSc, or Mtech from an IIT or a Tier 1 institute 2. Experience of 5+ years building scalable Products. Understanding of MVC design patterns working with datasets of big sizes, threads, microservices and e-commerce carts 3. Have experience in tech stacks building WMS, OMS or eCommerce plugins on Shopify/Woocommerce/Magento, product exp and architect exp 4. Experience in hiring and building world-class tech teams 5. You don't hesitate to voice your opinion 6. You have a strong technical foundation 7. You want to execute scalable/high-performance code on either the frontend and backend or both understanding complex technical areas along the way 8. You want to build efficient and reusable systems that drive complex web and mobile applications 9. Create software features that are robust, reliable, and user-friendly for both internal teams and our customer base. 10. Run the full software development lifecycle - problem definition, design, development, testing, demoing, and supporting production use of the features you own. Extra awesome if you are : 1. A fan of the speed of startups, having worked at one or more (including maybe your own) before. 2. Participate regularly in competitive hackathons 3. Familiar with modern open-source technologies 4. Have earlier been part of the core or founding of tech startups. Job Location: Ahmedabad, Work from Office

JD: The Technical Project Manager is responsible for planning, executing, and finalizing technical projects according to strict deadlines and within budget. This includes acquiring resources and coordinating the efforts of team members and third-party contractors or consultants to deliver projects according to plan. The Technical Project Manager will also define the projects objectives and oversee quality control throughout its life cycle. Key Responsibilities: Project Planning: Define project scope, goals, and deliverables that support business goals in collaboration with senior management and stakeholders. Develop comprehensive project plans that include schedules, milestones, and resource allocation. Execution and Monitoring: Direct and manage project development from beginning to end. Coordinate with cross-functional teams to ensure all aspects of the project are compatible and will meet stakeholder expectations. Monitor project progress and make adjustments as necessary to ensure the successful completion of the project. Budget Management: Develop and manage project budgets, ensuring that spending is aligned with project goals. Track project costs and make financial forecasts to ensure projects are completed within budget. Risk Management: Identify and manage project risks and issues, developing contingency plans as needed. Implement risk mitigation strategies to minimize impact on project delivery. Communication: Effectively communicate project expectations to team members and stakeholders in a timely and clear fashion. Facilitate project meetings and produce regular reports on project status, issues, and performance to stakeholders. Quality Assurance: Ensure that all projects are delivered on-time, within scope, and within budget. Conduct project post-mortems and create a recommendations report in order to identify successful and unsuccessful project elements. Team Leadership: Lead, coach, and motivate project team members on a proactive basis. Develop and deliver progress reports, proposals, requirements documentation, and presentations. STRATEGY MARKETPLACE    - Our Marketplace offers a suite of pre-tested and validated portfolios from some of the most trusted and renowned global investment managers. The service allows for a plug-and-play capability for banks and financial institutions to leverage the most effective strategies that address the varied investment needs of their client groups.            You will drive engineering strategy and vision for one of the key product verticals of the WeInvest platform and oversee its development and management     You'll work directly with the Head of Engineering and Head of Product Management     You will play a key role in architecting & designing the platform from the ground up, hiring the core engineering team, business planning & budgeting and end-to-end oversight of product technology and operations     You will show hustle, take ownership and help foster a high-energy, high-performance culture     This position is based out of Bangalore, India           Key responsibilities for this role include:       Lead one of the product verticals in the development of technology strategy, planning, hiring and execution of the next iteration of the WeInvest platform.      Institutionalize a strong software engineering culture and facilitate a rapid, iterative, layered development approach.      Be hands on with the coding, evaluate design and architecture choices, do in-depth code reviews, and implement standards and practices for software development.      Inspire the engineering team to build quality, scalable code by pairing with team members periodically.      Participate in the definition and management of high-quality product roadmaps based on business, product & tech strategy.      Create delivery plans and manage execution in weekly sprints by working very closely with the product manager.      Be the owner of every aspect of platform technology, operations and engineering processes including infrastructure, codebases, SaaS & PaaS tools, security, application performance and optimization.      Proactively identify and resolve strategic issues that may impair the team s ability to meet strategic, financial, and technical goals.        The ideal candidate will have:       Between 8-15 years of experience with a substantial part of it in product development & engineering management in FinTech, Wealth Management, Investment Management domain      Willingness to roll up your sleeves and do whatever is necessary; general manager / owner mentality with an entrepreneurial spirit.      Successful track record of delivering high-quality online / mobile products from conception through completion on time and within budgets.      Demonstrated ability to hire and manage top notch tech talent is a must.      Ability to think strategically, conceptualize and prioritize projects and execute methodically.      Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to work effectively on shared projects with designers, program managers, testers, and other developers.      Experience in the retail banking / wealth management domain is a big plus.      Familiarity with Markets and Financial Structures (e.g. Stock Market, Bond Market, Auctions, Options, Futures, etc.) is a big plus.      Strong team-orientation and the ability to work with multi-cultural, geographically distributed and cross functional teams.

column2: Lead a software test and DevOps team       supporting current and next generation medical device development to treat and improve the lives of people with cardiac arrhythmias. Establish strong relationships with direct reports, including scheduling regular 1:1s, and participate in providing and accepting timely, candid feedback in unrelenting pursuit of continuous personal and team improvement.          With the support of Talent Acquisition staff, lead hiring/staffing efforts for all CAS MEIC software engineering roles.     Strategize on, evaluate, and execute resourcing strategies that meet supply and demand over multiple years.     Support growing the size of the MEIC CAS team.          Guide, coach, and develop software test and DevOps engineers to attain their professional objectives for growth while ensuring functional success and high performance for the business.          Heavily collaborate with U.S.-based CAS SW functional managers and product owners for software program planning, encompassing scope, cost, schedule, and resourcing strategies.              Become the primary designated lead for CAS software at MEIC.              Work closely with the CAS SW-FW management team to represent and advocate for the CAS-MEIC team, continuing to improve the working norms of the team within a new and growing partnership.     Educate U.S.-based management team on cultural norms and best practices to support high retention of CAS MEIC staff.             Advocate for and provide support towards CAS capital medical devices being shipped to and safely used in MEIC labs.             Lead one or more team process improvement efforts across CAS SW-FW, as aligned with skillset/experience and as designated by leadership.          Ensure completion of Medtronic SW DRM (Design for Reliability and Manufacturing) and Agile Scrum training for self and team.          Establish a culture of quality and safety in conjunction with strong innovation, as well as high collaboration across the organization.     Listen to team s concerns, and advocate for safety- and reliability-driven additional work when necessary.          Train on and apply the appropriate standards, processes, procedures, and tools throughout the software development life cycle, following FDA regulations and IEC 62304 for medical device software.     Ensure training of direct reports is appropriate.             Maintain an attitude of positive flexibility, sometimes performing assigned work outside the boundaries of a typical software engineering manager job description to meet overall team deadlines and milestones.               Responsibilities may include the following and other duties may be assigned.         Oversees activities of the company s development and design requirements for software systems, applications and software quality assurance for enhancements and new products, including cloud-based or internet-related tools, to meet the current and future Software needs.     Manages activities to assure programs are appropriately resourced and ensure continuous improvement in technical capability, process, and compliance.     Manages scope, cost, and schedule within a cross-functional development team.     Selects, develops, and evaluates personnel to ensure the efficient operation of the function.           Must Have: Minimum Requirements               A Bachelor s Degree in technical field with 15 years of relevant experience, or advanced degree with 3 years of relevant experience.          2+ years of direct software engineering (test and/or DevOps) experience.          3+ years of experience in management , leading the execution of processes, people, and projects within software testing and DevOps.          Nice to Have           Degree in computer science, electrical engineering          Master s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science          Experience managing one or more software teams, including performing hiring activities and performance reviews.          Experience working with multi-site or remote teams, in particular direct collaboration with U.S.-based colleagues.          Strong knowledge of software testing, test automation, regression testing, and validation DevOps          Experience with highly regulated and/or safety-critical systems is required (medical device experience strongly preferred).          Solid understanding of structured product development: requirements-driven engineering, requirements documentation, rigorous verification, risk analysis, etc.          Experience with Microsoft suite of tools (Project, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.)          Very strong verbal and written English communication skills.          Able to influence leadership and team regarding issues that impact the business and its technical service and product strategies.          Experience with Agile Scrum.          Experience in development and maintenance of large electro-mechanical capital products with embedded firmware and application software running on Windows or Linux.          Multiple years experience as a SW test engineer using automated testing.     Understanding of broad technical software testing concepts such as test-driven development, behavior-driven development, white box and black box testing.          Familiarity with common software development test tools/platforms/languages (GIT, JIRA, TFS, Polarion, C#/.NET,      CodedUI, Appium, Microsoft Test Manager, etc).          Familiarity with DevOps CI/CD pipelines.          Experience with 21CFR Part 820 and ISO 13485, and ISO 62304 .                   Proven ability to work in a team environment with strong collaboration skills, engaging with technical and non-technical staff across multiple geographical RD sites, including significant remote/videoconference-based work.                       Up to 15% travel internationally.

column2: Job Summary This role is responsible for leading a team of software firmware engineers in designing, developing, and maintaining firmware solutions that drive the functionality and performance of hardware devices and embedded systems.  The role works closely with hardware engineers, software developers, project managers, and other stakeholders to deliver robust and reliable firmware products.  The role involves managing the entire firmware development lifecycle, from design and coding to testing and deployment. Responsibilities Leads the preparation and creation of instructional technical manuscripts for firmware operation. Manages resources to complete programming projects, and designs detailed plans to ensure firmware is functioning properly. Leads multiple project teams of other software firmware engineers and internal and outsourced development partners responsible for all stages of design and development for complex products and platforms, including solution design, analysis, coding, testing, and integration. Manages and expands relationships with internal and outsourced development partners on firmware design and development. Reviews and evaluates designs and project activities for compliance with systems design and development guidelines and standards; provides tangible feedback to improve product quality and mitigate failure risk. Manages project meetings, schedules, milestones and delivery, including managing vendors and manufacturing partners to achieve teams goals. Fosters collaboration between software firmware engineers, hardware engineers, software developers, and other stakeholders to achieve seamless integration of firmware with hardware and software components. Serves as an expert on all firmware related topics and acts as overall firmware leadership to provide perspective to cross-organization projects, programs, and activities. Stays updated with industry trends and emerging technologies related to firmware development, ensuring the team remains innovative and competitive. Provides guidance and mentoring to less-experienced staff members. Education & Experience  Recommended Four-year or Graduate Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Electrical Engineering, or any other related discipline or commensurate work experience or demonstrated competence. Typically has 7-10 years of job-related experience or 5-7 years of management experience, preferably in firmware development, or a related field. column2: The ideal candidate is able to lead an engineering team and leads a team of engineers and technical staff, providing guidance, mentorship, and support to ensure the teams effectiveness and productivity     He is able to convincingly to win energy engineering projects     That means continuously interacting with clients, understanding their current practices and executing engineering deliverables     Being able to solve interesting and non-obvious challenges stemming from the interdisciplinary nature of the engineering work     If you have experience with gaining engineering projects and leading the delivery team and have excellent knowledge of engineering design, we are looking for you         Job Description       An engineering manager in industrial plant engineering typically oversees the technical aspects of a plants operations and projects. Their role involves a combination of managerial responsibilities and technical expertise.        Heres a breakdown of the job description:       1. Team Leadership: The engineering manager leads a team of engineers and technical staff, providing guidance, mentorship, and support to ensure the teams effectiveness and productivity.   2. Project Management: They are responsible for planning, organizing, and overseeing engineering projects within the plant. This includes setting project goals, allocating resources, establishing timelines, and ensuring that projects are completed on time and within budget.   3. Technical Expertise: Engineering managers are expected to have a strong technical background in industrial plant engineering, including knowledge of mechanical, electrical, and chemical engineering principles. They use this expertise to evaluate designs, troubleshoot problems, and make informed decisions.   4. Process Improvement: Continuous improvement is essential in industrial plant engineering. Engineering managers identify opportunities to optimize processes, reduce costs, and improve efficiency within the plant. This may involve implementing new technologies, redesigning workflows, or streamlining operations.   5. Compliance and Safety: Ensuring compliance with industry regulations and safety standards is a crucial aspect of the role. Engineering managers must stay updated on relevant regulations and implement measures to maintain a safe working environment for employees while also ensuring environmental compliance.   6. Budgeting and Cost Control: They manage budgets for engineering projects and departmental expenses, working to optimize spending while delivering quality results. This includes estimating project costs, tracking expenses, and identifying opportunities for cost savings.   7. Communication and Collaboration: Effective communication is essential for coordinating with other departments, stakeholders, and external partners. Engineering managers must communicate project updates, technical information, and requirements clearly and effectively to ensure alignment and collaboration across the organization.   8. Risk Management: Identifying and mitigating risks is a key responsibility. Engineering managers assess potential risks associated with projects or operations and develop strategies to minimize their impact on safety, quality, and timelines.   9. Training and Development: They support the professional growth of their team members by providing training opportunities, performance feedback, and career development guidance.     Overall, the role of an engineering manager in industrial plant engineering is multifaceted, requiring a balance of technical expertise, leadership skills, and business acumen to ensure the effective and efficient operation of the plants engineering deliverables.       Your profile:           To be qualified for this role, you should be a qualified registered engineer, like B. Tech / B.E/ M.eng Engineering civil / structural / piping      Best performing candidate will have the potential to be absorbed on a permanent role. Ultimately, you will be a person our customer s trust. They will rely on you to provide timely and accurate solutions to their technical problems. enrolled in engineering. Preferred Civil, Mechanical, Structural.      Any familiarity work experience in Oil&Gas, refinery , Industrial works is essential      Familiarity with E3D , AutoCAD , 3D modelling is a requisite.      Good knowledge of Finite element analysis and engineering basics will be a plus.     Knowledge on engineering items in the Oil & Gas, Industrial plant engineering will only add valuable weightage. Previous elementary experience with software s such as STAAD-PRO & CAESER will be an added advantage.     Familiar with Ubuntu/Windows and programming in C++, Python ( an added advantage)     You are self-driven, autonomous, passionate about Digitalization.     Good English language skills (spoken and written)     Willingness to work in an inter-cultural and international environment.     Ability to work independently and as part of a team.     Curiosity and self-motivation     Good presentation skills are a pre-requisite.     Intensive training in scientific and transferable skills, participation in schools conferences and workshops.     Required to travel to Customer location if required.         Your primary tasks:             Ensure effective engineering deliverables to the customers.     Managing the technical support by executing engineering projects alongside customer yet proving the TIME as value proposition.     Execute and conduct and handle technical client queries.     Demonstrate engineering deliverables and their delivery during technical demo s to the potential clients.

column2: ?       As Engineering Manager - Machine Learning Perception at Motive, you will be a part of a passionate team whose mission is to bring intelligence to the world s trucking fleets. You will have a unique opportunity to work with a high caliber and fast-paced team of experienced and well-published researchers and engineers in AI, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, and Computer Vision, with a track record of delivering highly performant safety products for the physical economy.      You will be responsible for leading a talented team of machine learning, computer vision and embedded engineers, fostering innovation, and ensuring the successful delivery of projects aligned with Motive s business objectives. You will also build pipelines with edge processing, large and scalable MLOps infrastructure and vast amounts of in-house data to train, test, and validate production quality AI systems.     The role covers the entire lifecycle of AI products from conception to development, deployment and completion and Motive s AI pipeline from camera to customer. Successful candidates will bring their technical expertise in AI, machine learning or computer vision and project management experience to design, plan, execute and deliver AI products.       What You ll Do:          Lead teams that architect and deliver on multiple projects with cross-functional dependencies     Lead technical design of the next-generation of AI-driven Motive products     Be a subject matter expert in one or more AI, ML, deep learning or computer vision domains provide high-level scientific and technical leadership for the Motive AI team     Partner with leadership to understand product needs, identify priorities and drive AI/ML/CV roadmap and strategy for Motive s product and platforms     Be a highly technical as well as effective people manager, set clear expectations goals, measure team performance and impact     Increase visibility of Motive AI and help grow the team         What We re Looking For:              5+ years of experience in developing products with machine learning, AI, deep learning, or another related technical area      3+ years of experience as a technical project manager or scientific lead for AI/ML projects from concept to product, managing a team of 5-10 individual contributors     Bachelor s degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, mathematics or related field      Experience in one or more of Python, C/C++, ML deep learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow/Keras, PyTorch, Keras, scikit-learn, H20)     Ability to solve problems analytically and creatively     Strong communication (written and oral) skills     Familiarity/experience with hands-on development in computer vision with applications in the automotive domain is a strong plus     Familiarity/experience with containerizing using Docker and/or other environments; deployment on AWS, Kubernetes/Kubeflow, CI/CD pipelines or other distributed/cloud platforms is a plus     Familiarity/experience with embedded machine learning and/or optimizing and deploying ML models on embedded devices is a strong plus           ?

column2: We are currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced Engineering Manager to join our dynamic team     As an Engineering Manager, you will play a critical role in leading and managing our engineering department to successfully execute projects and drive innovation     If you have a passion for technology and possess exceptional leadership and project management skills, this may be the perfect opportunity for you         Responsibilities:         1. Leadership and Team Management:     - Lead, mentor, and manage a team of engineers, providing guidance and support in their professional growth and development.   - Foster a culture of collaboration, innovation, and high-performance within the engineering department.   - Set clear expectations, objectives, and performance goals for your team members, conducting regular performance reviews and providing constructive feedback.   - Encourage and promote a positive work environment, valuing diversity and inclusion.       2. Project Planning and Execution:     - Oversee the planning, design, and execution of various engineering projects, ensuring they are completed within agreed timelines and budgets, and meeting quality standards.   - Collaborate with cross-functional teams (product management, design, manufacturing, etc) to align project requirements and deliverables.   - Continuously monitor project progress, identify and address any issues or bottlenecks, and adjust plans as needed to meet project objectives.   - Uphold a commitment to operational excellence, following industry best practices and ensure compliance with relevant regulations and standards.       3. Technical Expertise:     - Maintain a deep understanding of engineering principles and industry trends, and leverage this knowledge to guide and support the engineering team.   - Provide technical expertise and guidance during the development and execution of engineering projects, ensuring optimal solutions are identified and implemented.   - Collaborate with engineers to troubleshoot and resolve complex technical issues, while promoting continuous improvement and innovation.       4. Stakeholder Management:     - Collaborate closely with internal and external stakeholders, including executives, customers, and vendors, to understand their needs and expectations.   - Effectively communicate project updates, technical concepts, and potential risks to stakeholders, ensuring a clear understanding among all parties involved.   - Foster strong relationships with stakeholders, understanding their requirements and incorporating feedback to drive project success.       Qualifications:     - Bachelors degree in Engineering (preferably in Mechanical, Electrical, or Industrial Engineering).   - Proven experience (X+ years) in a leadership or management role within the engineering field.   - Demonstrated track record of successfully managing the full project life cycle, from planning to execution.   - Strong technical background and experience in engineering principles, practices, and methodologies.   - Excellent leadership and interpersonal skills, with the ability to motivate and develop a team.   - Strong problem-solving abilities and a results-driven mindset.   - Excellent verbal and written communication skills.       Conclusion:         This Engineering Manager role at Trask presents an exciting opportunity to lead and manage a dynamic engineering team     By leveraging your technical expertise and leadership abilities, you will play a vital role in driving success and innovation within our company     As a part of the Trask team, you will have the opportunity to contribute to the development and execution of cutting-edge engineering projects in a collaborative and supportive work environment     If youre ready to take on new challenges and shape the future of engineering at Trask, we look forward to receiving your application     The role of an Engineering Manager is crucial in any organization as they are responsible for overseeing and managing the engineering team and the projects they work on     They play a significant role in ensuring the efficient functioning of the engineering department while aligning it with the companys goals and objectives     In this blog post, we will discuss the roles and responsibilities of an Engineering Manager in more detail       1. Team Management:     One of the primary responsibilities of an Engineering Manager is to manage and lead the engineering team. This includes recruiting and hiring talented engineers, providing guidance and mentoring, and fostering a positive and productive work environment. They are responsible for managing the teams performance, conducting performance reviews, and offering career development opportunities.       2. Project Management:     Engineering Managers are responsible for overseeing and managing engineering projects from start to finish. This includes defining project scope, setting goals and objectives, creating project plans, and allocating resources effectively. They ensure that projects are delivered on time and within budget, while also maintaining the necessary quality standards.       3. Strategic Planning:     Engineering Managers need to align the engineering departments goals and activities with the overall company strategy. They work closely with senior management and stakeholders to understand the vision and objectives of the organization. Based on this, they develop engineering strategies and plans that support the companys goals while driving innovation and efficiency within the engineering department.       4. Resource Allocation:     Efficiently allocating resources is another crucial responsibility for an Engineering Manager. They must assess the needs and requirements of different projects and allocate resources such as human resources, equipment, and budget accordingly. Effective resource management ensures that projects are adequately staffed and equipped, enabling the team to deliver results effectively.       5. Collaboration and Communication:     An Engineering Manager plays a vital role in facilitating collaboration and communication within the engineering team and across other departments. They interact with cross-functional teams, such as product management and quality assurance, to ensure seamless coordination and delivery. They also act as a bridge between senior management and the engineering team, conveying requirements, updates, and progress reports efficiently.       6. Risk Management:     Identifying and managing risks is an essential responsibility of an Engineering Manager. They need to anticipate potential risks associated with projects and proactively develop strategies to mitigate them. By having sound risk management practices in place, they ensure that projects are delivered successfully with minimal setbacks or delays.       7. Continuous Improvement:     Engineering Managers are responsible for fostering a culture of continuous improvement within the engineering department. They encourage the identification and implementation of process enhancements, technological advancements, and best practices to drive efficiency and quality. They are also responsible for staying up-to-date with industry trends and incorporating relevant innovations into their projects and workflows.         In conclusion, the role of an Engineering Manager encompasses a wide range of responsibilities     They play a crucial role in managing and leading the engineering team, ensuring projects are delivered on time and within budget, aligning the engineering department with the companys goals, and fostering continuous improvement     A competent and effective Engineering Manager is instrumental in driving success and innovation within an organization
column11: Product management, TPM, Manager Quality Assurance, Team management, Strategic planning, Project planning, Resource management, Continuous improvement, Risk management, Black Belt

column2: Job description  PLC programmer About our Line of Business The Microgrid business is core to Schneider Electric?? strategy and is one of the pillars of its Sustainability, Digitization and Electrification agenda. Microgrids are key to the transformation and reshaping of the global Energy landscape to build more cost effective, sustainable and resilient energy systems supporting the global Energy transition. The Microgrid Line of Business is providing the software, the architectures and the necessary system components to allow Commercial and Industrial customers to design, build, operate and maintain their distributed energy resources in grid or off grid connected mode, enabling them to reach their energy sustainability, Net-zero and resilience objectives in a profitable manner. About the role This role has the primary responsibility to drive growth of MicroGrid business through delivery of innovative Edge algorithms. The incumbent will be accountable to deliver algorithms and to enrich the existing programs embedded within PLC or other Edge hardware as well as to test and validate the hardware through simulation means. This role will report to the Microgrid R&D Manager. This role will work in collaboration with a team of architects, marketing, internal and external stakeholders. Responsibilities You will be responsible to:  Develop algorithms for Edge hardware based on the backlogs managed by the technical product owner.  Ensure that the algorithms are consistent with the cloud software and the physical devices.  Ensure that all the use cases of the system are factored into consideration while creating the algorithms.  Develop/Update new libraries of components as and when there are new devices or new functionalities are added to the system.  Ensure the functional verification test are performed with simulation means.  Ensure the algorithms are compatible with existing and new planned platforms like Automation Expert.  Ensure delivery of associated documentation and training materials. Profile / Qualification  Bachelors / Masters in relevant stream  4Y+ Experience in Energy Automation & electrical distribution.  Passionate about Sustainability, Energy Efficiency and new Energy landscape topics.  Expertise in Industrial automation software, PLC programming & SCADA - Knowledge of Schneider PLCs and tools is preferred.  Expertise in Industrial communication protocols including Modbus TCP/IP  Programming in Structured text and / or Ladder logic in compliance with IEC61131.  Programming in IEC61499 / Automation Expert - (Preferred)  Knowledge of Electrical systems and Power Management Systems (Controls, Power inverters, BESS, PV inverters, Gensets, etc.)  Knowledge of software development tools ??GitHub, Azure DevOps  Experience of working in Agile-Scrum environmen NotesView Opening Attachments?View Org Unit Attachments?

column2: You will explore multiple technologies and collaborate with different teams within EADP and game teams worldwide. The aim is to inspire creativity and performance for EAs upcoming games, ensuring that our engineering solutions are both efficient.         Your role will involve a mix of leadership and hands-on technical work. you'll guide a team towards maintaining in their work, from performance and maintainability to quality and automation. you'll also help collaborate with multiple team members to understand their needs, designing software solutions that are well-documented, maintainable, and meet EAs quality standards.         Regard technical leadership, you will call for someone who can mentor and support the teams professional development. you'll advocate for best practices in software development, engaging in the technical direction, and contributing to the design and implementation of features.             Your Experience             To be successful in this role, you have at least 10 years of relevant industry experience, including 2 years in a leadership role. A passion for managing teams, an ability to motivate and help team members, and a technical foundation, are essential. You have demonstrated deep experience with cloud platforms, container technologies, and continuous integration and deployment practices, having deployed large-scale web applications designed to support high traffic volumes and mission-critical services, ensuring robustness, scalability, and reliability. Promote technical direction, design, and implementation for features, applying your knowledge to provide solutions.         Engage in architecture, design, and code reviews, promoting and continuous improvement.             Qualifications:             Bachelor s or master s degree in computer science or equivalent industry experience.         10+ years of relevant work experience, with at least 2+ years in a leadership role managing a technical team.         Knowledge in team management theory, techniques, and career development practices.         Proficiency in object-oriented programming and experience with functional programming. Outstanding communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to deliver technical presentations and produce high-quality technical documentation

column2: As an Engineering Manager at BigStep Technologies, you will be part of a fast-growing business that allows high-performing employees to make an impact and contribute to the business growth. You will have the opportunity to channel your experience into contributing towards the development of our enterprise-grade software platforms. You will act as a driving force and ensure that optimised solutions are developed using Agile-based development methodology. In this role, you will be collaborating closely with multiple cross-functional teams. Primary responsibilities would also include coaching software development teams to self-organise and create high-value products to remove any impediments to their progress.          This is an excellent opportunity to make an impact on a massive scale, with room for growth in personal and professional development, while working with foundational next-generation technologies. This engineering manager s role offers the opportunity for significant technical impact, product innovation and team building with the opportunity for advancement.          Key Responsibilities:            Lead our platform s engineering team.              Form and drive the platform s technical strategy and roadmap, making sure they are executed properly.              Collaborate with Product Managers and Tech Leads for roadmap delivery.              Take ownership of on-time and with quality delivery of major/minor releases with the product teams to drive internal and external adoption of our platform.              Be an inspiring, inclusive and collaborative leader for a team of strong engineers responsible for delivering on business value.              Your technical contribution scope won t be limited just into cycle delivery goals, but there is an expectation that you engage in technical deliverables such as RFC reviews,bug fixes, and small features, without blocking or slowing down your team s progress.              You will be responsible for identifying the process bottlenecks and clearing any potential roadblocks.              You will play a role in building the team with the right culture, partnering with other teams, planning sprints and executing the plans.              You are expected to contribute as an active member of the global product team, a member of our leadership team responsible for delivering high business values.            Required Experience and Skills:            B.E / M.E with specialization in Computer Science / Information Technology              Diverse experience of 8+ years in a hyper-growth environment              A minimum experience of 3 years in development and technical leadership role              Should have minimum 2 years of experience in managing Scrum Teams.              Extensive experience in designing and developing software applications by putting the latest technology stacks to use in an Agile environment              Prior hands-on experience working through the design, development and release cycle              Hands on experience in full stack development, including RESTful API, JavaScript (jQuery, Angular/React, NodeJS, etc.), MongoDB, server component technologies              Experience using Agile performance metrics to drive accountability and continuous improvement              Proven leadership and motivational skills and the ability to maintain high levels of energy and engagement

column2: Your Opportunity -  We are seeking a versatile senior software manager to develop cutting-edge software solutions for new/existing products in Inspection domain.  Inspection provides  the science, techniques, and precision devices that are used to determine if parts or features of chip have any defective locations.  Using Inspection tool chipmakers can achieve the required extreme inspection sensitivity, inspect more often, collect more data, accelerate yields, and lower the cost per wafer.  The system combines industry-leading speed with high resolution and advanced optics that capture more data per scan. Inspection Product: In this role, your duties will be to develop and deploy new product with latest technology. Build strong team with Agile mindset and adopt quick changes according to the business need. column2: We are seeking a    Senior Connector Expert    to join our dynamic team. Reporting to the Director of Integrations, you will play a crucial role in researching and implementing connectors to both cloud and on-premise applications. Your expertise will be pivotal in translating your research into a connector using Pathlock s Open Connector Framework. You will also provide level 3 support for customers, ensuring their needs are met with professionalism and efficiency.            Key Responsibilities:                     Take ownership of connectors to several applications.              Lead the research, development, and implementation of connectors.              Serve as the primary point of contact for these connectors.              Spearhead end-to-end implementation projects for connectors into new applications, from research to successful customer delivery.              Skills:                 Integration:                     Proficient in creating and consuming APIs, including RESTful APIs, JSON (jsonpath, jsonpatch), Soap API s, Odata, Graphql, XML, and PowerShell.              Familiarity with modern authorization and authentication mechanisms, such as JSON Web Token, OAuth,              Database experience with expert knowledge of SQL, including Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle, and SQLite.              Experience with single sign-on solutions using technologies such as SAML and OpenId Connect.              Tools:                     Proficiency in Postman, Soap UI, and Git.              Research:                     Ability to quickly and independently learn and understand new applications and platforms.              Documentation:                     Ability to document research and development following standards.              Language:                     Excellent verbal and written English.              Experience with Cloud ERP systems and other cloud applications:                     Experience with multiple major enterprise cloud applications.              Expert knowledge of the authorization concept of at least one ERP application.            We are looking for individuals who are quick learners, deliver quality results, and take ownership of their work. If you are someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment and is eager to make a difference, we would love to hear from you.
column11: ERP, MS SQL, GIT, Cloud Applications, SOAP UI, XML, JSON, Research, SAML, Oracle

column2: We are looking for a highly skilled and motivated Engineering Manager to join our development team and manage a team of highly skilled and motivated engineers that would design and build integrations between enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems and eCommerce platforms for our innovative tax compliance solutions.               Responsibilities               Performance Objectives               Here are some of the things we expect you to do when you join us:                                     Integrations and Connectors       : Dig into our cloud native Avalara product suite. We are looking to build and expand our market penetration through an extensive suite of integrations and connectors through a flexible, extensible platform capable of handling any source platforms. At the same time, we want to expose all the tax nuances through our integrations. Help us build and manage the team building this while maximizing performance, scalability and reliability and making it oh-so-simple to operate.                   Automation vs People Power       : Computers are great for process automation but there is a limit to what it can do, and you know where that limit is. You will tackle the unique challenges that occur at the intersection of software and people driven tasks and apply these solutions to the novel business automation that Avalara aims to create.                       Industry Leadership       : Avalara is the market leader, and we intend on staying that way. That means we cannot be complacent. We actively encourage everyone to make bold moves and keep testing their limits. We expect you to innovate and produce innovative ideas to make things better.                   You are not just another engineer when you join Avalara. You + Avalara equal endless possibilities!                           Develop and execute a comprehensive integration strategy for connecting our tax-based solution with a range of ERPs and eCommerce platforms.                     Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align integration efforts with overall product and business goals.                 Lead, mentor, and inspire a team of skilled engineers, providing guidance on best practices, architecture, and development methodologies.                 Foster a culture of innovation, collaboration, and accountability within the engineering teams.                 Leverage your deep understanding of ERP systems (e.g., SAP, Oracle, Microsoft Dynamics) and eCommerce platforms (e.g., Shopify, Magento, WooCommerce) to design and implement robust integrations.                 Ensure seamless data flow and real-time synchronization between systems, minimizing latency and ensuring data integrity for an ever-growing client-base and increasing data volumes.                     Drive the design and development of high-quality, scalable, and maintainable integration solutions.                 Oversee the full software development lifecycle, from requirements gathering and design to implementation, testing, deployment, and post-release support.                  Build POCs to demonstrate the technical solution feasibility.                 Focus on security aspects, observability, scalability, and telemetry.                 Perform code reviews and ensure coding standards and practices are followed.                     Implement and follow agile/scrum processes.               Qualifications             Bachelor/masters degree in computer science or equivalent                 15+ years of full stack experience in software design and development, with a proven track record of successfully leading teams in building integrations with ERPs and eCommerce platforms.                     Exceptional leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.                 Good understanding of Object-oriented programming languages                 Good understanding of ERP and eCommerce system architectures, APIs, data models, and authentication mechanisms.                 Good experience with RESTful APIs, JSON, XML, and other data interchange formats.                 Familiarity with authentication protocols like OAuth and token-based authentication.                     Experience in working in an Agile team with hands on with TDD, BDD                 Excellent problem-solving skills and a demonstrated ability to navigate complex technical challenges.                 Experience of working on AWS Cloud and DevOps (Terraform, Docker, ECS, etc.) would be beneficial.                 Excellent analytical and troubleshooting skills to be able to solve complex problems and critical production issues.                 Proven track record of delivering high-quality software projects on time.

column2: The Job This role is for a Sr. Manager of Cloud Engineering, part of the Global Infrastructure Core Technologies (GICT) Team. This role provides point for our Cloud Operations Team that supports infrastructure on behalf of several WBD business units and all WBD brands. This includes new infrastructure developments, migrations, support, and maintenance. This individual will be exposed to a variety of IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS platforms including Amazon Web Services (AWS), Google Cloud and Microsoft Azure to support best practices for running enterprise level applications in the cloud. This individual will have a background in both Linux Systems Engineering and Windows Systems Engineering. Proficiency in Terraform or Cloud Formation for Infrastructure-as-Code is required. The Sr. Manager of Cloud Engineering is responsible for developing and sustaining an efficient and effective cloud operation team; overseeing highly available infrastructure in the cloud, automated code deployment pipelines and securing the account using best practices and procedures defined by the GICT team. Spoken and written English is required. The Daily Major Activities  Operational Responsibilities Grow and develop a world-class cloud support team. Provide direct technical and managerial oversight to lead an expanding cloud engineering support team. Oversee support of cloud infrastructure for enterprise applications. Ensure existing automated deployment pipelines are operational and sound. Work closely with the rest of the Engineering teams to automate & improve infrastructure deployments where needed. Implement and improve incident triage, escalation, monitoring and alerting. Ensure security compliance and governance assessments are conducted and followed as needed. Provide and improve upon production readiness assessments. Project Responsibilities Participate in prioritizing, coordinating, planning, executing, and closing projects and tasks to produce the required deliverables. Research product and technical data to recommend products, technologies, and processes for ongoing projects & improvements. Act as a mentor for other cloud operation team members when troubleshooting infrastructure, middleware, and related applications. Lead group-brainstorming sessions with cloud operations support teams. Keep Cloud Engineering teams and other teams updated on changes to architecture and infrastructure standards and tooling. Keep operations and project teams well informed of changes regarding status of assigned tasks. Create and deliver presentations to Cloud Engineering teams or other teams and to management as needed. Communicate with clients regarding maintenance, incidents, and projects. Attend online meetings with teams in the U.S. as needed. Work Experience Minimum of 12-15 years of experience working in technology, with increasing levels of responsibility. Minimum 5 years of demonstrated management and leadership experience. Demonstrated experience establishing automation-first teams and systems. Minimum 3 years working experience in public cloud environments, particularly Amazon AWS or Microsoft Azure. 5+ years of professional experience with DevOps fundamentals and Systems Engineering in Linux and Windows. Good Knowledge of scripting. Strong knowledge of automation methodologies, languages, and tooling. Solid familiarity with Systems Engineering, Operating systems, Networking concepts and security. Knowledge/Skills & Competencies Technical KnowledgeSkills Solid understanding of AWS services and products (EC2, ECS, Fargate, VPC, SQS, RDS, S3, IAM, CloudWatch, etc.) Experience with AWS platform for building infrastructure using IaC methodologies Capable of serving as a subject-matter expert in topics related to web hosting architecture, such as high availability, CI/CD, performance analysis, scaling, SSL, local and global load balancing, caching, and troubleshooting Experience with CI/CD - AWS CodeBuild, CodePipeline Ability to provide technical leadership and support to developers for designing and deploying modern solutions. Solid understanding of version control systems (git), including branching and merging strategies. Experience with scripting languages such as Python, Bash, Node, PowerShell. Working knowledge of Terraform and CloudFormation for building infrastructure as code. Strong Linuxand Windowssystem administration background.
column11: Cloud Engineering, RDS, S3, PowerShell, Node, VPC, Bash, Google Cloud, Fargate, git, ECS, SQS, IAM, EC2, CloudWatch, CI/CD, Microsoft Azure, Python
